column1: 3972629205,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bdo-italia-3972629205?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=UXLuSQEBg4LLi4h9WBUK%2FQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,BDO Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Nel nostro team AI & Data Analytics sarai il fulcro di un sistema mirato a guidare le principali realtà enterprise italiane e non verso la Trasformazione Digitale tramite l’Intelligenza Artificiale e la Data Analytics.
Sarai in una posizione privilegiata per poter cogliere esigenze nascenti e offrire risposte professionali, occupandoti di:
Implementazione processi ETL, sviluppo e gestione architettura BI per supportare processi aziendali data-driven e generare insight utili per prendere decisioni informate
Raccogliere, integrare e analizzare dati provenienti da varie fonti per identificare pattern, tendenze e insight per ottimizzare i processi aziendali
Definizione di KPI per monitorare la bontà di algoritmi/processi
Creazione di modelli di reportistica e analisi in Power BI (Dashboard interattive) e redigerne la relativa documentazione (manuali utente)
Scrittura di semplici script di automazione in Python o metodi alternativi per ottimizzare le operazioni di elaborazione dei dati
Implementazione di controlli qualità e integrità del dato
Collaborazione con altre funzioni aziendali e stakeholder interni ed esterni per identificare le esigenze e garantire che le analisi siano allineate agli obiettivi
YOU ARE THE RIGHT TALENT IF YOU BRING US:
Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Statistica o altre discipline affini
Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto MSOffice e tecnologie di Business Intelligence, in particolare Power Query e Power BI (DAX)
Capacità di disegnare e progettare soluzioni di data modeling (E-R)
Conoscenza delle tecniche di Data Visualization
Mentalità analitica che ti consente di approcciarti ai dati e alle situazioni in modo critico, identificando soluzioni e prendendo decisioni rapide e consapevoli
Eccellente comprensione del business e capacità di tradurre i requisiti aziendali in soluzioni tecniche
Esperienza lavorativa in società di consulenza direzionale o informatica sarà considerata un forte plus.
YOU FEEL WELCOMED EVERY DAY BECAUSE:
ti sentirai da subito parte della squadra, supportato nel proporre le tue idee e visioni
respirerai un dinamismo che dà energia, un concetto di collaborazione che fa crescere la professionalità di ognuno e la qualità del team
scoprirai una forma di ambizione che sposta sempre in avanti il punto di arrivo e rende appassionante il percorso per raggiungerlo
apprezzerai il supporto di un People coach, che ti aiuterà a sviluppare il tuo potenziale e le tue competenze
troverai percorsi di carriera disegnati sulle tue ambizioni e capacità
sperimenterai i benefici della flessibilità e dello smart working.
WE ARE QUALITY SEEKERS, CLIENT SUPPORTERS, TEAM BELIEVERS & PASSION PROMOTERS

Ci impegniamo per offrire al paese un modello di crescita sostenibile. Siamo appassionati di consulenza e di revisione ed è proprio la passione che ci ha resi una delle più importanti società mondiali in questo campo. Ci guida una motivazione forte, che si diffonde in ognuna delle nostre sedi in 164 Paesi e che troverai nei nostri 14 uffici in Italia. Amiamo il talento e le idee nuove e cresciamo grazie all’attenzione che riserviamo alla competenza delle persone e alla qualità delle relazioni: quelle all'interno della nostra società e quelle con i clienti e i fornitori.
MAKE YOUR CAREER DEEPLY SIGNIFICANT, JOIN US AND SHARE OUR PURPOSE.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?


Nel nostro team AI &

3977345312,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-business-intelligence-at-gruppo-feltrinelli-3977345312?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=ChC9ezA3sMS87MOwEWkrHA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Analista business intelligence,Gruppo Feltrinelli,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Per il nostro Gruppo cerchiamo una figura di Business Analyst che opererà all’interno della unità di Business Intelligence, a supporto in particolare del settore Retail Omnichannel.
Elaborare e analizzare dati di business (come vendite, KPIs, ST%, coverage e altri parametri chiave) utilizzando i tools di analisi di dati
Analizzare in modo proattivo e costante il trend per identificare punti critici / definire action plan
Sviluppo di nuovi standard reports su base weekly e monthly per valutare performance vs target e per supportare i diversi team ed il personale dei negozi
Fornire Executive summary e report ad-hoc in base ai trend del mercato, con informazioni rilevanti per il business e feedback qualitativi
Monitorare livelli di stock e copertura per garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di vendita e di sell-thru
Indagine delle attuali metriche utilizzate o mancanti, in funzione dello sviluppo del nuovo sistema BI
Lavoro a stretto contatto con IT per l’implementazione del nuovo sistema di BI
Ricerca di eventuali data issues in collaborazione con IT ed i relativi partner commerciali allo scopo di avere dati consistenti a tutti I livelli
Gestire o creare le relazioni con i differenti stakeholders

Il candidato/a ideale ha conseguito una laurea ad indirizzo economico. Possiede una solida esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni in un ruolo analogo, preferibilmente nel settore Retail e/o in società di consulenza strategica.

Il candidato/a possiede ottime capacità di pensiero strategico orientato al business, problem solving, capacità di riconoscere le priorità e di gestire il tempo in funzione di queste, capacità di lavorare in team e di agire con proattività in contesti dinamici.

column2: nice to have: Power BI.

3967479479,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-crm-at-venchi-3967479479?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=tZGqDRW%2BgGhu0APzUJV13g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Data Analyst - CRM,Venchi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Data Analyst - CRM to join our team based in Milan!

Reporting to the Business Data Manager, you will drive the strategic objectives of the company by leveraging data analytics and fostering a data-driven culture within the CRM team. You will be pivotal in transforming data into actionable insights. By collaborating with cross-functional teams and utilizing advanced data analysis techniques, the role aims to optimize customer engagement and business outcomes.
Participate in agile CRM meetings to define and prioritize the most impactful analyzes to achieve strategic objectives.
Develop comprehensive analysis to achieve the objectives set during the sprints, ensuring clarity in macro-objectives.
Interpret the results of the analysis and recommend the best next actions for the company.
Collaborate with data scientists and data engineers as needed to evolve analysis into more complex models or use artificial intelligence.
Promote a data-driven culture within the CRM team.
Support BI champions in using existing BI reports or creating new ones.
Using a data-driven approach identify and create new customer segments for new marketing campaigns
Become a champion in the adoption of the company Customer Data Platform - D365 customer insight data
Master’s Degree in STEM disciplines (Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering)
In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
At least 2 years of experience in CRM data analytics in a retail company or consultancy company on projects for retail customers
Proven experience working in cross-functional/agile teams (including data scientists, data engineers, and business stakeholders).
Familiar with generative AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT)
… and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!

Join us at Venchi, and through the innovative use of technology and collaboration across functions, help us transform insights into actions that achieve our business objectives and exceed customer expectations.
We look forward to hearing from you!

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Data Analyst - CRM to join our team based in Milan!


Reporting to the Business Data Manager, you will drive the strategic objectives of the company by leveraging data analytics and fostering a data-driven culture within the CRM team. You will be pivotal in transforming data into actionable insights. By collaborating with cross-functional teams and utilizing advanced data analysis techniques, the role aims to optimize customer engagement and business outcomes.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Participate in agile CRM meetings to define and prioritize the most impactful analyzes to achieve strategic objectives.
  • Develop comprehensive analysis to achieve the objectives set during the sprints, ensuring clarity in macro-objectives.
  • Interpret the results of the analysis and recommend the best next actions for the company.
  • Collaborate with data scientists and data engineers as needed to evolve analysis into more complex models or use artificial intelligence.
  • Promote a data-driven culture within the CRM team.
  • Support BI champions in using existing BI reports or creating new ones.
  • Using a data-driven approach identify and create new customer segments for new marketing campaigns
  • Become a champion in the adoption of the company Customer Data Platform - D365 customer insight data


Requirements:

  • Master’s Degree in STEM disciplines (Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering)
  • In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
  • Proficient in big data analysis
  • Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
  • At least 2 years of experience in CRM data analytics in a retail company or consultancy company on projects for retail customers
  • Proven experience working in cross-functional/agile teams (including data scientists, data engineers, and business stakeholders).
  • Fluent Italian and English
  • Familiar with generative AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT)
  • … and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!


Join us at Venchi, and through the innovative use of technology and collaboration across functions, help us transform insights into actions that achieve our business objectives and exceed customer expectations.


We look forward to hearing from you!

3982688832,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-lynx-spa-3982688832?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=eChjwayTomgk7OBN%2FCdJLA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data Analyst,Lynx Spa,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.
Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.
Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.
Ecco una panoramica delle principali fasi:
Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione
Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI
Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori
Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
Flessibilità oraria e capacità di lavorare in team
Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere
Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto
Contratto: tirocinio retribuito di 6 mesi finalizzato all’assunzione.

Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV all'indirizzo cvannunci_mi@lynxspa.com, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.

Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.


Siamo alla ricerca di profili junior entusiasti e motivati da inserire nella nostra Business Unit specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence e Big Data.


Percorso Formativo: Durante lo stage, i tirocinanti seguiranno un percorso formativo strutturato per fornire competenze tecniche e professionali nel settore IT.


Ecco una panoramica delle principali fasi:


Studio Teorico:

  • Sistemi di basi dati e modelli relazionali
  • Linguaggi di programmazione: .NET 2012, C#, Python
  • Introduzione ai concetti di Data Warehouse e Business Intelligence
  • Fondamenti di Statistica inferenziale e Machine Learning
  • Approccio conoscitivo all'AI generativa


Autoapprendimento:

  • Accesso a libri, corsi online e video training
  • Esercitazioni pratiche e quiz di autovalutazione


Contestualizzazione Funzionale:

  • Apprendimento pratico tramite progetti reali
  • Utilizzo di tecnologie come Windows Server, SQL Server, MongoDB, Visual Code, Visual Studio e strumenti di BI come Power BI


Lavoro in Team:

  • Interfacciamento con un team e un referente di progetto
  • Partecipazione a meeting di stato avanzamento lavori


Requisiti necessari:

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Gestionale o Informatica (indirizzo Data Science/Machine Learning)
  • Conoscenza teorica di basi dati e modelli relazionali
  • Utilizzo avanzato del pacchetto MS Office (Excel, Word)
  • Flessibilità oraria e capacità di lavorare in team
  • Dedizione allo studio e forte volontà di apprendere


Cosa offriamo:

  • Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale
  • Supporto costante da parte di un supervisore esperto
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti innovativi e di alto impatto


Sede di lavoro: Milano


Contratto: tirocinio retribuito di 6 mesi finalizzato all’assunzione.


Se sei appassionato di IT e desideri iniziare la tua carriera in una realtà dinamica e innovativa, inviaci il tuo CV all'indirizzo cvannunci_mi@lynxspa.com, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679) e riportando nell'oggetto il riferimento all'annuncio.

3996394395,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analysis-stage-at-ewiva-3996394395?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=BaZ3tMtfEo6RAqM1aH4ebw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data analysis stage,Ewiva,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.

Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.

Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.
Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.
Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:
Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management
Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?
Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia
Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!
Prima di inviare la tua candidatura, ti preghiamo di prendere visione dell’informativa privacy disponibile al seguente link: https://ewiva.com/privacy-policy-area-lavora-con-noi/.
Lo stage avrà una durata di 6 mesi.
Sarà previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilità di lavorare in smart working.

Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.


Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.


Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.


Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.

Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:

  • Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
  • Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
  • Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
  • Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
  • Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
  • Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management


Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

  • Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
  • Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
  • Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
  • Orientamento al cliente
  • Capacità di sviluppare presentazioni


Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?

  • Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
  • Prima esperienza con Salesforce
  • Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
  • Inglese e italiano fluenti
  • Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia


Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!


Prima di inviare la tua candidatura, ti preghiamo di prendere visione dell’informativa privacy disponibile al seguente link: https://ewiva.com/privacy-policy-area-lavora-con-noi/.


Cosa ti offriamo?

Lo stage avrà una durata di 6 mesi.

Sarà previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilità di lavorare in smart working.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

As a Data Analyst in our Onboarding domain, you will support decision-making in our product development processes to enhance the efficiency of our Customer Due Diligence teams and ensure a smooth onboarding experience for Mollie’s customers. You will also provide actionable insights or help product teams extract insights themselves using our self-serve reporting tools.

You will work closely alongside the domain’s leadership team and software engineers to ensure we collect and store the right data. Then working alongside other data professionals, you’ll build robust data models, perform in-depth analyses and tell compelling stories to steer our product teams in the right direction.
Product development: work closely with the domain leadership team and engineers to make sure our products synthesise the data required to measure product performance.
Product analytics: dive deep into frontend / behavioural event data to identify friction points, growth opportunities and other potential product levers.
Data modelling: transform data from different sources into clean, robust, performant, easy to use data models based on the analytical needs of your stakeholders.
Data storytelling: turn your insights into compelling stories and share them via presentations, blog posts, memos, dashboards, workshops, or whatever works best!
Business Intelligence: build and maintain robust, performant data models (dbt + Looker) to empower your stakeholders to report their most important product KPIs.
Craft development: contribute to the evolution of the data analytics craft by sharing your insights, challenges and being a vocal member of the community.
3+ years experience as data analyst or data scientist using data to drive product success
Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
Proactive, pragmatic and have a ‘can do’ attitude
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
Fluency in SQL (we use BigQuery) and experience with dbt
Experience working with a BI tool (we use Looker)
Experience with A/B testing and experimentation
Experience with R, Python, or other programming languages

Your opportunity

As a Data Analyst in our Onboarding domain, you will support decision-making in our product development processes to enhance the efficiency of our Customer Due Diligence teams and ensure a smooth onboarding experience for Mollie’s customers. You will also provide actionable insights or help product teams extract insights themselves using our self-serve reporting tools.

You will work closely alongside the domain’s leadership team and software engineers to ensure we collect and store the right data. Then working alongside other data professionals, you’ll build robust data models, perform in-depth analyses and tell compelling stories to steer our product teams in the right direction.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Product development: work closely with the domain leadership team and engineers to make sure our products synthesise the data required to measure product performance.
  • Product analytics: dive deep into frontend / behavioural event data to identify friction points, growth opportunities and other potential product levers.
  • Data modelling: transform data from different sources into clean, robust, performant, easy to use data models based on the analytical needs of your stakeholders.
  • Data storytelling: turn your insights into compelling stories and share them via presentations, blog posts, memos, dashboards, workshops, or whatever works best!
  • Business Intelligence: build and maintain robust, performant data models (dbt + Looker) to empower your stakeholders to report their most important product KPIs.
  • Craft development: contribute to the evolution of the data analytics craft by sharing your insights, challenges and being a vocal member of the community.

What You Have

  • 3+ years experience as data analyst or data scientist using data to drive product success
  • Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proactive, pragmatic and have a ‘can do’ attitude
  • Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
  • Fluency in SQL (we use BigQuery) and experience with dbt
  • Experience working with a BI tool (we use Looker)
  • Experience working with Git

Nice to haves

  • Experience with A/B testing and experimentation
  • Experience with R, Python, or other programming languages

3942126292,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-stage-at-sennder-3942126292?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=GFNZiHUZgIolmBtTqi%2BD8w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst Stage,sennder,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our ""About Us"" presentation.

We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst Intern in the Operations Program & Innovation department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in enhancing real-time visibility and driving advancements in tracking technologies. You will support the management of the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" collaborating with various stakeholders to develop processes aimed at delivering high-quality services to our carriers and shippers. Additionally, you will assist in leading projects focused on visibility and service quality improvements to meet company objectives.
Assist in managing the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" working closely with internal and external stakeholders.
Support the execution of projects aimed at improving our services, contributing to the achievement of company goals.
Assist in the preparation of ad hoc analyses, forecasts, reports, and presentations for senior leadership, providing insights into the effectiveness of outputs.
Aid in building, managing, and maintaining performance reports and dashboards related to key metrics such as GPS coverage, Perfect Service Shipment, and On-Time Performances.
Collaborate with the Product Team to contribute ideas for new solutions, enhancements to existing ones, and draft business requirement documents.
Assist in monitoring and enhancing GPS integration processes of carriers regularly.
Support daily interactions with third-party service providers to enhance real-time visibility.
Serve as a primary point of contact for Operations Teams regarding visibility and service quality matters.
Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, statistics, or a related field.
At least 1 year of experience in operations management, quality management, performance management, consulting, or similar roles.
Preferred experience in the transportation/logistics industry or familiarity with supply chain visibility concepts.
Proficiency in G-suite and MS Office
column2: SQL skills are a plus.

column1: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and proactively.
Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset.
Fast learner with a collaborative approach to teamwork.

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.
Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000+ people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click here for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.
If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

3989390121,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-business-insight-analyst-at-giorgio-armani-3989390121?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=m%2BI1ijFhxMiw2kKDpBH8CQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Digital Business Insight Analyst,Giorgio Armani,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione lavoro:

The Armani Group is a leading company in the fashion and luxury sector, with more than 8,000 employees. Its three core brands – Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange – are active in many countries all over the world. With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Today, therefore, as well as being well known in the area of fashion, the Armani Group is also renowned in the sectors of interior design, food and beverage, and hotels and resorts. Giorgio Armani has created a style that has, with remarkable consistency, continued to explore countless variations and possibilities over the years. It expresses a precise vision down to the most minute detail: a way of being and presenting oneself, certainly incorporating clothing and accessories, but also including gestures, ways, behaviours and attitudes
column2: a style that goes beyond the sum of its parts, and well beyond what one wears. Convinced that ethics and aesthetics must coincide, Giorgio Armani expresses fundamental and enduring values his clothes. He does so by creating timeless pieces that, enhanced by precious materials and artisanal craftwork, resist the whim of fleeting trends with their pure and essential design.

column1: Context and Purpose of the job

Within the Digital Business Unit, you will join the Business Intelligence & CRO Management team. You will play a pivotal role in supporting the team in all the daily analysis regarding E-commerce, identifying and sharing actional insights to different stakeholders.Responsibilities
Process and analyze E-commerce data using data analysis tools to identify actionable insights to maximize online revenue and find new opportunities
Follow deep dive analysis on several business aspects and clearly communicating results to different stakeholders
Conduct standard monthly/weekly/daily reports focusing on brand/region/countries performance
Design, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring the accuracy of the data provided
Support the Digital Team in the extraction of data and creation of ad-hoc analysis
Analyze performance at product level and quantify the impact of promotions both in terms of revenues and business impact
Collaborate with Retail, CRM, Merchandising and Buying team in order to provide comprehensive analysis of different collections/seasons
Provide analysis and interpretation of internal/external market data, highlighting any underlying trends to identify new market opportunities to increase the organization’s profitability
Keep the Digital Team updated on the latest trends focusing on E-commerce and Competition in the Fashion Industry
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science
Previous experience of 2 years in business analytics, the experience in E-Commerce will be considered a plus
Advanced Excel required, knowledge of Power BI (or other similar Data VisualizationTools) and other BI tools (SAP BO, Microstrategy, ecc).
Analytical skills, organization, proactivity, attention to details, strong communication skills.
We promote diversity and inclusion in all forms, within a collaborative environment where your talent can flourish in the pursuit of a common goal: yours and our growth.

Descrizione lavoro:

The Armani Group is a leading company in the fashion and luxury sector, with more than 8,000 employees. Its three core brands – Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange – are active in many countries all over the world. With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Today, therefore, as well as being well known in the area of fashion, the Armani Group is also renowned in the sectors of interior design, food and beverage, and hotels and resorts. Giorgio Armani has created a style that has, with remarkable consistency, continued to explore countless variations and possibilities over the years. It expresses a precise vision down to the most minute detail: a way of being and presenting oneself, certainly incorporating clothing and accessories, but also including gestures, ways, behaviours and attitudes
column2: a style that goes beyond the sum of its parts, and well beyond what one wears. Convinced that ethics and aesthetics must coincide, Giorgio Armani expresses fundamental and enduring values his clothes. He does so by creating timeless pieces that, enhanced by precious materials and artisanal craftwork, resist the whim of fleeting trends with their pure and essential design.
column3: Context and Purpose of the job
column4: Within the Digital Business Unit, you will join the Business Intelligence &
column5: CRO Management team. You will play a pivotal role in supporting the team in all the daily analysis regarding E-commerce, identifying and sharing actional insights to different stakeholders.Responsibilities
column6:
• Process and analyze E-commerce data using data analysis tools to identify actionable insights to maximize online revenue and find new opportunities
  • Follow deep dive analysis on several business aspects and clearly communicating results to different stakeholders
  • Conduct standard monthly/weekly/daily reports focusing on brand/region/countries performance
  • Design, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring the accuracy of the data provided
  • Support the Digital Team in the extraction of data and creation of ad-hoc analysis
  • Analyze performance at product level and quantify the impact of promotions both in terms of revenues and business impact
  • Collaborate with Retail, CRM, Merchandising and Buying team in order to provide comprehensive analysis of different collections/seasons
  • Provide analysis and interpretation of internal/external market data, highlighting any underlying trends to identify new market opportunities to increase the organization’s profitability
  • Keep the Digital Team updated on the latest trends focusing on E-commerce and Competition in the Fashion Industry

Requirements
column7:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science
  • Previous experience of 2 years in business analytics, the experience in E-Commerce will be considered a plus
  • Advanced Excel required, knowledge of Power BI (or other similar Data VisualizationTools) and other BI tools (SAP BO, Microstrategy, ecc).
  • Analytical skills, organization, proactivity, attention to details, strong communication skills.
column8: &nbsp
column9: We promote diversity and inclusion in all forms, within a collaborative environment where your talent can flourish in the pursuit of a common goal: yours and our growth.

Ti occuperai di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei nostri Clienti. Parteciperai alla creazione delle dashboard per il monitoraggio sull'efficacia dei modelli e dei strumenti implementati. Inoltre, sarai coinvolto nell’efficientamento dei processi di business e nella definizione dei modelli predittivi:

Svilupperai ed implementerai le dashboard di monitoraggio dei KPI quantitativi volte a identificare l'efficacia dei modelli e processi operativi, confrontando i risultati effettivi con piani e previsioni

Supporterai i direttori operativi nella definizione della pianificazione di dettaglio per garantire consistenza tra capacità produttiva ed esigenze di business attraverso la definizione di modelli predittivi e matematici per forecast di volumi e pianificazione risorse
Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse business unit aziendali per sviluppare, testare e rifinire i processi
Supporterai il “change management” accompagnando gli utenti nell’adozione dei nuovi processi e delle procedure.
Laurea in ambito scientifico, preferibilmente in statistica
Esperienza lavorativa di almeno 2 anni in ruoli affini, preferibilmente in società di consulenza o aziende che operino in ambito operations
Forte motivazione a intraprendere un percorso di rapida crescita, che ti vedrà gestire in autonomia progetti strategici per il business aziendale
Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi
Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività
Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team
Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.
Tipologia di inserimento: Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Ral di riferimento: 32.000 € + bonus + Ticket Restaurant
Modalità di Lavoro ibrida: SW 3 giorni a settimana

3996230989,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-air-connected-mobility-3996230989?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=YQ3UNIGFQc0xrpTNmBaj0g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior Data Analyst,Air - Connected Mobility,"Vigevano, Lombardy, Italy","Siamo un broker assicurativo con sede a Vigevano in provincia di Pavia.

Confrontiamo per il cliente finale i diversi preventivi offerti dalle compagnie assicurative e proponiamo il più vantaggioso, sulla base delle esigenze richieste. Inoltre, mettiamo la nostra piattaforma a disposizione dei dealer che collaborano con noi, in modo da permettere loro di offrire ai clienti oltre ad un servizio di vendita auto, anche una polizza. La nostra missione è quella di portare digitalizzazione e innovazione a tutti gli stakeholder del processo assicurativo dai singoli automobilisti ai partner assicurativi fino ai dealer e ai fleet manager.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una ""IOT Analyst"" che voglia lavorare nel settore delle Connected Cars. Il/la candidato/a ideale ha una profonda conoscenza della matematica e dei linguaggi di programmazione di base per l'analisi dei dati. Questo ruolo richiede una stretta collaborazione con i team di prodotto e vendite per massimizzare il valore dei nostri prodotti e servizi nel mercato delle auto connesse.
Analisi dei Dati: Utilizzare competenze matematiche per analizzare grandi quantità di dati generati dai veicoli connessi.
Collaborazione Interdisciplinare: Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di prodotto per comprendere le esigenze del mercato e con il team di vendite per supportare strategie basate sui dati.
Innovazione Tecnologica: Rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze tecnologiche nel campo delle auto connesse e proporre nuove soluzioni per migliorare i prodotti e i servizi.
Rapporti e Presentazioni: Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per condividere le analisi e le intuizioni con vari stakeholder interni.
Supporto Decisionale: Fornire supporto basato su dati per le decisioni di business e di prodotto.
Conoscenza Matematica: Capacità di applicare concetti matematici avanzati per l'analisi dei dati.
Conoscenza dell'IoT e delle Auto Connesse: Comprensione delle tecnologie e dei trend relativi all'IoT e alle auto connesse.
Abilità di Comunicazione: Capacità di comunicare efficacemente con team interfunzionali, inclusi quelli di prodotto e vendite.
Analisi e Risoluzione dei Problemi: Forti capacità analitiche e di problem-solving.
Capacità di Lavorare in Team: Abilità di lavorare efficacemente in ambienti di squadra e interfunzionali.
Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica o Economia.
Eventuali certificazioni o corsi aggiuntivi in analisi dati, programmazione o tecnologie IoT saranno considerati un plus

Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77 eD.lgs. n.198/2006) e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità (D.lgs. 215/03 e 216/03)

Siamo un broker assicurativo con sede a Vigevano in provincia di Pavia.

Confrontiamo per il cliente finale i diversi preventivi offerti dalle compagnie assicurative e proponiamo il più vantaggioso, sulla base delle esigenze richieste. Inoltre, mettiamo la nostra piattaforma a disposizione dei dealer che collaborano con noi, in modo da permettere loro di offrire ai clienti oltre ad un servizio di vendita auto, anche una polizza. La nostra missione è quella di portare digitalizzazione e innovazione a tutti gli stakeholder del processo assicurativo dai singoli automobilisti ai partner assicurativi fino ai dealer e ai fleet manager.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una ""IOT Analyst"" che voglia lavorare nel settore delle Connected Cars. Il/la candidato/a ideale ha una profonda conoscenza della matematica e dei linguaggi di programmazione di base per l'analisi dei dati. Questo ruolo richiede una stretta collaborazione con i team di prodotto e vendite per massimizzare il valore dei nostri prodotti e servizi nel mercato delle auto connesse.


Responsabilità Principali

  • Analisi dei Dati: Utilizzare competenze matematiche per analizzare grandi quantità di dati generati dai veicoli connessi.
  • Collaborazione Interdisciplinare: Lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di prodotto per comprendere le esigenze del mercato e con il team di vendite per supportare strategie basate sui dati.
  • Innovazione Tecnologica: Rimanere aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze tecnologiche nel campo delle auto connesse e proporre nuove soluzioni per migliorare i prodotti e i servizi.
  • Rapporti e Presentazioni: Preparare report dettagliati e presentazioni per condividere le analisi e le intuizioni con vari stakeholder interni.
  • Supporto Decisionale: Fornire supporto basato su dati per le decisioni di business e di prodotto.


Competenze Richieste

  • Conoscenza Matematica: Capacità di applicare concetti matematici avanzati per l'analisi dei dati.
  • Conoscenza dell'IoT e delle Auto Connesse: Comprensione delle tecnologie e dei trend relativi all'IoT e alle auto connesse.
  • Abilità di Comunicazione: Capacità di comunicare efficacemente con team interfunzionali, inclusi quelli di prodotto e vendite.
  • Analisi e Risoluzione dei Problemi: Forti capacità analitiche e di problem-solving.
  • Capacità di Lavorare in Team: Abilità di lavorare efficacemente in ambienti di squadra e interfunzionali.


Qualifiche Educative

  • Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Statistica, Matematica o Economia.
  • Eventuali certificazioni o corsi aggiuntivi in analisi dati, programmazione o tecnologie IoT saranno considerati un plus


Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto full time - Stage



Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L.903/77 eD.lgs. n.198/2006) e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità (D.lgs. 215/03 e 216/03)

3930441224,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-at-prima-3930441224?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=OVAOUrAcaT8J%2Ba%2FWzkkMyA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Product Data Analyst,Prima,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Is it a thrilling opportunity in a dynamic environment which is constantly evolving what you are currently looking for?

Are you curious to see how a company that operates in the Insurance sector provides a great experience at a great price to its customers using cutting-edge technologies to create and sell its products? Then, we are happy to inform you that you have just got a ticket to the fast lane!

IT technology lies at the very core of everything we do and our Engineering and Product departments are composed by passionate and innovative people who never stop learning and developing their skills employing the latest stacks and methodologies.
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you’d be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is — your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we’ve come a long way, we’ve created a culture where we can fuel each other’s success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You’re probably thinking… ‘That sounds pretty good’. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We’ve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development.
We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Working in a way that works for you We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We’ll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
🏁 The freedom to explore the possibilities We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We’re invested in your growth
column2: so we’ll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you’ll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: 🌈 Our winning formula: happy and high-performing From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we’re here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we’ll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
As a Product/Web Analyst, you will be responsible for
Analyzing the user interactions on website and app (behavioural data), in particular on funnel, using SQL query and different web analyst tools (GoogleAnalytics, Firebase, ContentSquare, ...)
Managing simple scripts and providing at the maintenance of all the digital analytics platforms in use (GTM, Looker Studio, GA4, Firebase, …)
Creating & monitoring dashboard on Tableau, Looker Studio or other BI tools
Improving product AB testing in order to increase the conversion rate and customer acquisition
Perform ad-hoc analyses to examine specific phenomena or validate business strategies
Supporting SEO manager with quantitative analyses in order to improve website ranking
At least 1 year of experience with GA4 or other digital analytics platforms
Basic knowledge of how a dataLayer works
Good knowledge of Excel and Tableau
Analytical skills and experience in manipulating and interpreting data from different sources
Experience in working in an IT departments
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Maths, Economics

Prima is a community made up of talented and ambitious individuals. We offer equal employment opportunities and are oriented towards diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.
If it sounds like we’d be a good fit for each other, join us in the fast lane!

Is it a thrilling opportunity in a dynamic environment which is constantly evolving what you are currently looking for?

Are you curious to see how a company that operates in the Insurance sector provides a great experience at a great price to its customers using cutting-edge technologies to create and sell its products? Then, we are happy to inform you that you have just got a ticket to the fast lane!

IT technology lies at the very core of everything we do and our Engineering and Product departments are composed by passionate and innovative people who never stop learning and developing their skills employing the latest stacks and methodologies.

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you’d be in the driving seat of your career
column2:
learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is — your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we’ve come a long way, we’ve created a culture where we can fuel each other’s success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You’re probably thinking… ‘That sounds pretty good’. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We’ve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development.

We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

🤸🏽‍♂️ Working in a way that works for you We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We’ll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

🏁 The freedom to explore the possibilities We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We’re invested in your growth
column3:
so we’ll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you’ll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

🌈 Our winning formula: happy and high-performing From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we’re here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we’ll go the extra mile to help you when we can.


As a Product/Web Analyst, you will be responsible for

  • Analyzing the user interactions on website and app (behavioural data), in particular on funnel, using SQL query and different web analyst tools (GoogleAnalytics, Firebase, ContentSquare, ...)
  • Managing simple scripts and providing at the maintenance of all the digital analytics platforms in use (GTM, Looker Studio, GA4, Firebase, …)
  • Creating &
column4:
monitoring dashboard on Tableau, Looker Studio or other BI tools
  • Improving product AB testing in order to increase the conversion rate and customer acquisition
  • Perform ad-hoc analyses to examine specific phenomena or validate business strategies
  • Supporting SEO manager with quantitative analyses in order to improve website ranking


    • Requirements

    • At least 1 year of experience with GA4 or other digital analytics platforms
    • Good knowledge of GTM
    • Basic knowledge of how a dataLayer works
    • Knowledge of SQL and GoogleBigQuery
    • Good knowledge of Excel and Tableau
    • Analytical skills and experience in manipulating and interpreting data from different sources


    Nice to have

    • Experience in working in an IT departments
    • Knowledge of Python
    • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Maths, Economics

We prohibit discrimination of any kind based on race, colour, gender, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, genetic information, pregnancy or other protected personal characteristics, as defined by national laws.

    If it sounds like we’d be a good fit for each other, join us in the fast lane!

Se cerchi la costruzione del tuo futuro professionale in un bell’ambiente, dove la PERSONA fa la differenza rispetto al NUMERO, allora sei nel posto giusto.
Sarai inserito/a in un'area strategica di un nostro importante cliente del settore Energy&Utilies, nell'area di Metering o Billing , dove ti occuperai di supporto operativo per le mansioni, quali:
● analisi i dati dei flussi, clusterizzazione e risoluzione di problematiche.
● Re-ingegnerizzare i processi di business attraverso idee innovative
● l’analisi del contesto, individuando i processi critici e le casistiche ricorrenti da efficientare
●la definizione di KPI relativi alle performance e la predisposizione di un sistema di monitoraggio
● formazione sui processi e le tecnologie
● Ticket da 10€ per ogni volta che si è presenti in ufficio
● sede di lavoro a Milano, la presenza è Ibrida e flessibile
● di avere buone competenze/interesse nell'analisi dei dati
● di voler aiutare nella costruzione dei processi
● di saper parlare fluentemente italiano C1
● di essere disponibile ad iniziare seconda metà di agosto
Nice to Have: Conoscenza di sistemi di Data Managing e Data Visualisation possono essere utili nello svolgimento del lavoro
Se sei arrivato fino qui e vuoi leggere ancora qualcosa di noi…
…siamo una Media Impresa innovativa, di 130 talenti che lavorano insieme con l’obiettivo di offrire soluzioni alle aziende di vendita e distribuzione Energy & Utilities.
Come i musicisti di un’orchestra legano le note per realizzare la migliore sinfonia, così noi uniamo testa e anima per dare ai clienti nuovi strumenti per affrontare le sfide del mercato.

È questa la filosofia che guida il nostro approccio: non aspettare, ma proporre idee brillanti e trasformarle in musica. Ideiamo e sviluppiamo software proprietari e innovativi, forniamo consulenza organizzativa e di processo ed evoluti servizi di business creando soluzioni personalizzate per i nostri clienti.
Ti aspettiamo sul nostro sito e a colloquio.

Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi della legge (L.903/77 e D.Lgs n. 98/2006, art 27). L'interessato è invitato a inviare la propria candidatura rilasciando specifico consenso al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi della nuova Normativa Europea sulla Privacy, conforme agli artt. 13 e 14 del GDPR (Regolamento (UE), 27 aprile 2016, n. 2016/679).
Contratto di lavoro: Tempo pieno, Tempo indeterminato

Se cerchi il solito lavoro da “stereotipo della consulenza”, allora non leggere oltre.

Se cerchi la costruzione del tuo futuro professionale in un bell’ambiente, dove la PERSONA fa la differenza rispetto al NUMERO, allora sei nel posto giusto.

Thales people architect solutions that are relied upon to deliver operational advantage at every decisive moment throughout the mission. Defence and armed forces customers rely on us to deliver the full range of defensive systems for land, sea, and air. From early warning, to threat neutralisation, our platforms cover all levels from very short-range systems, to extended protection across the entire battle-space including Airspace Mobility Solutions, Vehicles and Tactical Systems and Missile Defence, Optronics, and Radar.

Gorgonzola hosts Navigations Air Systems (NAS) domain. The activity of NAS domain: avionics, navigation and radar systems for civil air traffic and technologies supporting the activities of civilian and military pilots, ATC controllers and technicians of several airlines, air traffic control agencies and Air Force around the world. Italy is the Group’s Competence center for the design, production and delivery of Navigation Aids products and Competence Centre for the delivery of non-Radar Surveillance Products.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Operations team as we enhance and optimize our data architecture. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data infrastructure, with a focus on automating data updates and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of our SQL-based data lake. In addition, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to produce key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics, facilitating data-driven decision-making and
contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.
The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, excellent technical skills in Python and SQL, and a keen interest in the business aspect of our operations.
Design, build, and maintain our data architecture, ensuring the seamless flow and integration of data across various systems and platforms.
Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data updates, quality checks, and data transformations, optimizing efficiency and accuracy.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and translate them into actionable insights, KPIs, and business metrics.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, generating valuable insights to support business decision-making processes.
Contribute to the development and implementation of data-driven strategies, leveraging your understanding of both data analytics and business objectives.
Work closely with cross-functional teams such as IT, operations, and finance to ensure data governance, data integrity, and security.
Communicate data findings, insights, and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with new developments in data analysis, technology, and industry best practices, actively seeking opportunities for continuous learning and improvement.
Suggest new applications of AI and Machine Learning based on intimacy with data and operational processes
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, or a related
discipline. A master's degree is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in building and maintaining SQL-based data lakes and automating data processes using Python scripts.
Solid understanding of data architecture principles, data modeling, and data integration techniques.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis, extracting insights from complex datasets, and producing KPIs and business metrics.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to gather, assess, and interpret large volumes of data effectively.
Strong business acumen and the ability to connect data insights with organizational goals and strategy.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and statistical analysis tools is preferred.
Exceptional attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Proactivity, independence and creativity in solving problems
Strong analysis and critical thinking skills.
An ability to turn ideas and initiatives into projects
A flexible approach to work and an agile work style
Willing to learn and attention to details

At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Location: Gorgonzola, Italy

Thales people architect solutions that are relied upon to deliver operational advantage at every decisive moment throughout the mission. Defence and armed forces customers rely on us to deliver the full range of defensive systems for land, sea, and air. From early warning, to threat neutralisation, our platforms cover all levels from very short-range systems, to extended protection across the entire battle-space including Airspace Mobility Solutions, Vehicles and Tactical Systems and Missile Defence, Optronics, and Radar.

Gorgonzola hosts Navigations Air Systems (NAS) domain. The activity of NAS domain: avionics, navigation and radar systems for civil air traffic and technologies supporting the activities of civilian and military pilots, ATC controllers and technicians of several airlines, air traffic control agencies and Air Force around the world. Italy is the Group’s Competence center for the design, production and delivery of Navigation Aids products and Competence Centre for the delivery of non-Radar Surveillance Products.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our Operations team as we enhance and optimize our data architecture. As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data infrastructure, with a focus on automating data updates and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of our SQL-based data lake. In addition, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to produce key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics, facilitating data-driven decision-making and

contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.

The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, excellent technical skills in Python and SQL, and a keen interest in the business aspect of our operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain our data architecture, ensuring the seamless flow and integration of data across various systems and platforms.
  • Develop and maintain Python scripts to automate data updates, quality checks, and data transformations, optimizing efficiency and accuracy.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and translate them into actionable insights, KPIs, and business metrics.
  • Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement, generating valuable insights to support business decision-making processes.
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of data-driven strategies, leveraging your understanding of both data analytics and business objectives.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams such as IT, operations, and finance to ensure data governance, data integrity, and security.
  • Communicate data findings, insights, and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Stay up-to-date with new developments in data analysis, technology, and industry best practices, actively seeking opportunities for continuous learning and improvement.
  • Suggest new applications of AI and Machine Learning based on intimacy with data and operational processes


Education &
column2:
Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, or a related


discipline. A master's degree is a plus.

  • Strong proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in building and maintaining SQL-based data lakes and automating data processes using Python scripts.
  • Solid understanding of data architecture principles, data modeling, and data integration techniques.
  • Demonstrated experience in data analysis, extracting insights from complex datasets, and producing KPIs and business metrics.
  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to gather, assess, and interpret large volumes of data effectively.
  • Strong business acumen and the ability to connect data insights with organizational goals and strategy.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and statistical analysis tools is preferred.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Soft Skills

  • Proactivity, independence and creativity in solving problems
  • Strong analysis and critical thinking skills.
  • An ability to turn ideas and initiatives into projects
  • A flexible approach to work and an agile work style
  • Target oriented
  • Willing to learn and attention to details

3992491742,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-internship-at-groupm-italy-3992491742?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=DTEykfKpcZU7ni6Z0vdoIA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst Internship,GroupM Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Stiamo cercando giovani talenti con la passione per i Media, l’Advertising e i Dati da inserire all’interno del team di “Business Intelligence & Insight” di GroupM la unit specializzata nell’elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistiche e analisi di scenario, la scoperta di insight e lo sviluppo di soluzioni esclusive.

L’opportunità di stage prevede un percorso di crescita volto ad acquisire competenze relative al settore pubblicitario e dei media, attraverso il supporto e l’affiancamento in attività che vanno dalla pianificazione strategica alla misurazione delle campagne pubblicitarie.
Nello specifico la figura affiancherà il Digital Research Manager nelle seguenti attività:
Analisi e gestione database per validazione dati, intelligence interna e benchmarking
Elaborazione di reportistiche e presentazioni ad-hoc
Sviluppo di soluzioni proprietarie in ambito di ricerche e pianificazione
Monitoraggio dei trend emergenti legati al mondo della misurazione e delle ricerche
Supporto alle agenzie media nelle attività quotidiane (pianificazione strategica e consulenza)
Laurea in discipline Economiche o Statistiche
Passione per il mercato pubblicitario, i media, le ricerche e i sistemi di misurazione
Forti competenze analitiche/numeriche e particolare attenzione ai dettagli
Ottima capacità di gestione e utilizzo dei principali sistemi informatici, in particolare del pacchetto Office (Excel e PowerPoint)
Campus WPP Milano ((con possibilità di smart working per qualche giorno)

Siamo orgogliosi di avere un team composto da persone con background, esperienze e identità diverse. Crediamo che questa diversità sia un punto di forza. Questa posizione è dedicata anche alle persone appartenenti alle Categorie Protette ex l. 68/99

3989642477,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bending-spoons-3989642477?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=uacn9gi7bPpEuk2KjCZRsw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.


To achieve this mission, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.


For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.


A few examples of your responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
  • Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.


What we look for

  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
  • Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer

  • Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment &
