Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.


The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.


Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

3981950045,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-bv-tech-3981950045?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=eDu050Kop1JVZfOE1tO7lw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Data Analyst,BV TECH,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Il Gruppo BV TECH è un gruppo innovativo, fondato nel 2005, interamente italiano ed uno dei principali attori del mercato italiano dell’Information & Communication Technology e della Sicurezza delle Informazioni.

Il Gruppo comprende società di ingegneria, servizi informatici e sicurezza con più di 1000 dipendenti e ha sedi su tutto il territorio italiano (le principali a Milano, Roma, Genova e Grottaglie) e internazionale (Londra e Boston).

Particolarmente focalizzato sui temi della Cybersecurity, il gruppo è partner fondatore di (IC)3, il consorzio creato dal Massachusetts Institute of Technology (ora Cybersecurity At MIT Sloan - CAMS) per diffondere e sviluppare la cultura della sicurezza informatica nel settore della protezione delle infrastrutture critiche.

Il Gruppo BV TECH sviluppa tecnologie «nazionali» nel settore ICT in ambito sia civile sia militare (C4ISTAR), con l’ambizione di contribuire significativamente all’innovazione e alla crescita del Paese.
Le principali aree di expertise del Gruppo BV TECH sono:
Per potenziamento del Team di Sviluppo Software in ambito Agricoltura di Green Aus S.p.A., ricerchiamo un/una Business Data Analyst/Data Scientist!
Siamo alla ricerca di talenti per unirsi al nostro team.
Programmazione in ambito sanitario, in particolare modellazione di processi e sistemi a supporto del governo della domanda e dell’offerta
Tecniche di BPM e BPR applicate al contesto sanitario nonché pratiche e tecniche di miglioramento continuo
Identificazione degli obiettivi dell’analisi dei dati sanitari
Raccolta e definizione dei requisiti di Business
Mappatura dei flussi dati mediante l’utilizzo dell’analisi e conoscenze di data analysis e data quality

Analisi statistica dei dati con competenza avanzata nell’utilizzo di tecniche scientifiche di modellazione (Ricerca Operativa, Data Mining, Machine Learning) e capacità analitiche dei domini informativi di contesto
Consulenza sui dati a supporto delle iniziative di business per migliorare il sistema verso il cliente (data management)
Linguaggi di programmazione per la gestione dei dati, per l’analisi e la simulazione statistica e per la modellizzazione matematica
Definizione di modelli di comunicazione delle evidenze raccolte e di data visualization
📋 Sei la persona giusta per noi se hai:
Almeno 5 anni di anzianità in contesti come quelli richiesti dalla presente offerta
Ottima conoscenza di SAS Foundation Tools and Advanced Analytics

Ottima conoscenza in tecniche statistiche di analisi dei dati (Classificazione, Clustering, Data Mining, Stream Processing, What-if analysys) e dei principali algoritmi di Machine Learning (regressione logistica, random forest, reti neurali, K-means, SVM, etc.).
Capacità di identificare e applicare la corretta tecnica statistica
Solido approccio quantitativo, analisi e disegno di modelli
Attitudine nell’identificare opportunità per migliorare le performance e l’efficienza dei sistemi esistenti
Possibilità di crescita professionale all'interno dell'azienda
Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.016/679
Il Gruppo BV TECH è un gruppo innovativo, fondato nel 2005, interamente italiano ed uno dei principali attori del mercato italiano dell’Information &
column2:
Communication Technology e della Sicurezza delle Informazioni.

Il Gruppo comprende società di ingegneria, servizi informatici e sicurezza con più di 1000 dipendenti e ha sedi su tutto il territorio italiano (le principali a Milano, Roma, Genova e Grottaglie) e internazionale (Londra e Boston).

Particolarmente focalizzato sui temi della Cybersecurity, il gruppo è partner fondatore di (IC)3, il consorzio creato dal Massachusetts Institute of Technology (ora Cybersecurity At MIT Sloan - CAMS) per diffondere e sviluppare la cultura della sicurezza informatica nel settore della protezione delle infrastrutture critiche.

Il Gruppo BV TECH sviluppa tecnologie «nazionali» nel settore ICT in ambito sia civile sia militare (C4ISTAR), con l’ambizione di contribuire significativamente all’innovazione e alla crescita del Paese.

Le principali aree di expertise del Gruppo BV TECH sono:

  • Sviluppo soluzioni
  • Ingegneria
  • Gestione Servizi
  • Prodotti e Tecnologie


🔍Posizione:

Per potenziamento del Team di Sviluppo Software in ambito Agricoltura di Green Aus S.p.A., ricerchiamo un/una Business Data Analyst/Data Scientist!


Siamo alla ricerca di talenti per unirsi al nostro team.


💻Attività:

  • Programmazione in ambito sanitario, in particolare modellazione di processi e sistemi a supporto del governo della domanda e dell’offerta
  • Tecniche di BPM e BPR applicate al contesto sanitario nonché pratiche e tecniche di miglioramento continuo
  • Identificazione degli obiettivi dell’analisi dei dati sanitari
  • Raccolta e definizione dei requisiti di Business
  • Mappatura dei flussi dati mediante l’utilizzo dell’analisi e conoscenze di data analysis e data quality
  • Analisi statistica dei dati con competenza avanzata nell’utilizzo di tecniche scientifiche di modellazione (Ricerca Operativa, Data Mining, Machine Learning) e capacità analitiche dei domini informativi di contesto
  • Consulenza sui dati a supporto delle iniziative di business per migliorare il sistema verso il cliente (data management)
  • Linguaggi di programmazione per la gestione dei dati, per l’analisi e la simulazione statistica e per la modellizzazione matematica
  • Definizione di modelli di comunicazione delle evidenze raccolte e di data visualization



📋 Sei la persona giusta per noi se hai:

  • Almeno 5 anni di anzianità in contesti come quelli richiesti dalla presente offerta
  • Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office
  • Ottima conoscenza di SAS Foundation Tools and Advanced Analytics
  • Ottima conoscenza in tecniche statistiche di analisi dei dati (Classificazione, Clustering, Data Mining, Stream Processing, What-if analysys) e dei principali algoritmi di Machine Learning (regressione logistica, random forest, reti neurali, K-means, SVM, etc.).
  • Capacità di identificare e applicare la corretta tecnica statistica
  • Solido approccio quantitativo, analisi e disegno di modelli
  • Attitudine nell’identificare opportunità per migliorare le performance e l’efficienza dei sistemi esistenti
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese


📦 Cosa offriamo

  • Possibilità di crescita professionale all'interno dell'azienda
  • Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante
  • Smart Working
  • Assicurazione Sanitaria
  • Orario di lavoro: 9:00/18:00



Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.016/679

con conoscenze di Power BI, sarà responsabile della gestione autonoma dello sviluppo ETL e del Front-End di prodotto. Il ruolo prevede l'analisi dei dati, la progettazione e l'implementazione di soluzioni BI avanzate, con l'obiettivo di supportare il processo decisionale attraverso la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi. Inoltre, lavorerà a stretto contatto con i vari team per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche efficaci e intuitive.
Il nostro collega ideale, con esperienza pregressa in ruolo analogo di almeno 4 anni, deve possedere le seguenti caratteristiche:
Capacità di gestire autonomamente l'intero processo di sviluppo ETL.
Esperienza nella progettazione e nello sviluppo del Front-End di prodotto.
Conoscenze approfondite in tecniche di analisi dei dati e visualizzazione.
Capacità di lavorare sia in modo indipendente sia in team
🌐 Remote Working: Lavorare da casa con flessibilità e comfort.
🔄 Diversità dei Progetti: Opportunità di lavorare su progetti brevi, mantenendo sempre fresche e stimolanti le tue attività lavorative.
🏢 Welfare Contrattuale: Un budget di benefici contrattuali su misura.
🍽️ Buoni Pasto: Pasti garantiti ogni giorno di lavoro con i ticket elettronici.
💉 Fondo Sanitario Contrattuale: Protezione sanitaria completa per te e i tuoi famigliari a carico.
👥 Referral Program: Un programma di segnalazione senza limiti e per ogni nuovo collega che ci presenterai riceverai un premio.
📚 Training Personalizzato: Formazione su misura in base alle esigenze specifiche dei progetti su cui lavorerai.
🌴 Ferie e Permessi: 30 giorni complessivi tra ferie e permessi per goderti il tuo tempo libero.
💳 Convenzioni Esclusive: Sconti esclusivi per una vasta gamma di servizi, prodotti, viaggi, abbigliamento e tecnologia.
Il nostro processo di selezione è rapido e coinvolgente, composto da:
Un'opportunità per conoscerci meglio e scoprire più su di te.
Un incontro con i responsabili di progetto per esplorare le tue competenze e i tuoi interessi.
Se possiedi le caratteristiche giuste, il nostro responsabile HR sarà lieto di darti il benvenuto presentandoti la nostra offerta di collaborazione.
Inviaci il tuo CV aggiornato e dettagliato con autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi della Legge 196/03 e art.13 GDPR 679/13. 📄

Il Data Analyst in HRM

con conoscenze di Power BI, sarà responsabile della gestione autonoma dello sviluppo ETL e del Front-End di prodotto. Il ruolo prevede l'analisi dei dati, la progettazione e l'implementazione di soluzioni BI avanzate, con l'obiettivo di supportare il processo decisionale attraverso la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi. 3983963359,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-m-f-d-at-baywa-r-e-emea-3983963359?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=KAKROkn9NA5bH0y692Jl0w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d),BayWa r.e. EMEA,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"About us

BayWa r.e. Italia Srl is the Italian holding of the German multinational company BayWa r.e. We are a growth driven, global company and offer exciting opportunities at every career level with great development potential. We are active worldwide in the wind, solar and bioenergy sectors. For our customers, we are a valued and reliable partner with a diverse range of services.
For our company Energy Trading in Milan (MI), we are looking for a Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)

Plants and meteo data collection from SCADA systems and/or data logger of various PV plants and related quantitative analysis on power default and outages of PV plants. This task will focus on another source of uncertainty in the predicted production of PV systems: unplanned outage of components due to failure or deviations from their operating range (e.g., inverters getting too hot).

To tackle this problem, a statistical analysis on historical outage data will be conducted to identify patterns and correlations with energy trading activities. By understanding the link between outage duration and its potential impact on energy trading contracts, operators can implement risk management strategies and contingency plans. This will include analyzing the trade-offs with the self-consumption by the ancillary systems of the plant (e.g., cooling systems). Moreover, the task will yield indications on possible investment in equipment and maintenance practices to reduce the occurrence of power outages, ensuring smoother energy trading operations.

Develop probabilistic forecast at primary substation level to predict possible overgeneration that might cause congestion based on the data provided by the partners or publicly available data: starting from production forecast model of PV plants (provided) the aim of this task is to develop a forecasting service to predict grid congestion. Three levels of precision can be explored: (i) purely data driven forecasting of events, based on historical, publicly available information on congestion and redispatch events (ii) construction of graphs based on the physical topology of the power network and training based on historical data, and (iii) physics-informed machine learning to predict power flows and issues on lines and substations.

Trading strategies for value stacking: define and test trading approaches at the plant level, assuming that high-resolution probabilistic forecasts and some flexibility on the customer’s side are available considering the electrification of the energy system in the future scenarios. Different trading approaches will be tested. Eventually, based on the energy price signals from the ancillary services market, a techno-economic strategy based on probabilistic PV forecasting will be developed, to make PV-battery systems profitable to participate in both the ancillary services and day-ahead markets, rather than in the day-ahead market only.
What you will need to succeed
MS in engineering or other quantitative subjects
Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Good knowledge of quantitative analysis Coding capabilities
Ability to translate analysis into practical and implementable recommendations
Highly analytical thinker with a structured logical and pragmatic approach to problem solving
What We Are Ready To Offer You
International team (86 different nationalities working for BayWa r.e. across the globe)
Flat hierarchies, an open culture and plenty of leeway for your ideas
Modern office ambience (height-adjustable desks, additional monitors, ergonomic chairs, etc.)

At BayWa r.e. we are fully committed to fostering equity and inclusion and embrace the diversity, of all our people, both present and those yet to join us! We welcome applications from everyone, irrespective of gender, gender identity, national origin, religion, social-, cultural-, or ethnic-background, sex, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other status protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. We are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer for all by providing an inclusive environment free of discrimination or harassment.
If you as an applicant require additional assistance or accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please reach out to us.
Candidates of both sexes (Law 903/77) can send their CV giving authorization to personal data processing according to Legislative Decree 196/03

About us


BayWa r.e. Italia Srl is the Italian holding of the German multinational company BayWa r.e. We are a growth driven, global company and offer exciting opportunities at every career level with great development potential. We are active worldwide in the wind, solar and bioenergy sectors. For our customers, we are a valued and reliable partner with a diverse range of services.


About the role


For our company Energy Trading in Milan (MI), we are looking for a Data Analyst Intern (m/f/d)


What you will do


  • Plants and meteo data collection from SCADA systems and/or data logger of various PV plants and related quantitative analysis on power default and outages of PV plants. This task will focus on another source of uncertainty in the predicted production of PV systems: unplanned outage of components due to failure or deviations from their operating range (e.g., inverters getting too hot).
  • To tackle this problem, a statistical analysis on historical outage data will be conducted to identify patterns and correlations with energy trading activities. By understanding the link between outage duration and its potential impact on energy trading contracts, operators can implement risk management strategies and contingency plans. This will include analyzing the trade-offs with the self-consumption by the ancillary systems of the plant (e.g., cooling systems). Moreover, the task will yield indications on possible investment in equipment and maintenance practices to reduce the occurrence of power outages, ensuring smoother energy trading operations.
  • Develop probabilistic forecast at primary substation level to predict possible overgeneration that might cause congestion based on the data provided by the partners or publicly available data: starting from production forecast model of PV plants (provided) the aim of this task is to develop a forecasting service to predict grid congestion. Three levels of precision can be explored: (i) purely data driven forecasting of events, based on historical, publicly available information on congestion and redispatch events (ii) construction of graphs based on the physical topology of the power network and training based on historical data, and (iii) physics-informed machine learning to predict power flows and issues on lines and substations.
  • Trading strategies for value stacking: define and test trading approaches at the plant level, assuming that high-resolution probabilistic forecasts and some flexibility on the customer’s side are available considering the electrification of the energy system in the future scenarios. Different trading approaches will be tested. Eventually, based on the energy price signals from the ancillary services market, a techno-economic strategy based on probabilistic PV forecasting will be developed, to make PV-battery systems profitable to participate in both the ancillary services and day-ahead markets, rather than in the day-ahead market only.


What you will need to succeed


  • MS in engineering or other quantitative subjects
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Good knowledge of quantitative analysis Coding capabilities


Soft skills

  • Ability to translate analysis into practical and implementable recommendations
  • Highly analytical thinker with a structured logical and pragmatic approach to problem solving


What We Are Ready To Offer You


  • Smart working
  • International team (86 different nationalities working for BayWa r.e. across the globe)
  • Flat hierarchies, an open culture and plenty of leeway for your ideas
  • Modern office ambience (height-adjustable desks, additional monitors, ergonomic chairs, etc.)


Location: Milan

Term of contract: stage 6/12 months


You matter to us


At BayWa r.e. we are fully committed to fostering equity and inclusion and embrace the diversity, of all our people, both present and those yet to join us! We welcome applications from everyone, irrespective of gender, gender identity, national origin, religion, social-, cultural-, or ethnic-background, sex, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other status protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. We are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer for all by providing an inclusive environment free of discrimination or harassment.


If you as an applicant require additional assistance or accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please reach out to us.


Candidates of both sexes (Law 903/77) can send their CV giving authorization to personal data processing according to Legislative Decree 196/03

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.
Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:
Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.
Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).
Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.
Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.
Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)
Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunità tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attività

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sarà chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
  • Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
  • Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
  • Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.


Requirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
  • Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
  • Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.


Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale

  • Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
  • Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).


Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacità relazionali, affidabilità ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalità vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacità organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilità.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

3973970762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/supply-data-analyst-internship-at-ogury-3973970762?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=zFqhYTp3eN26asHj6Sh6dw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Supply Data Analyst - Internship,Ogury,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.
Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we’re changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.

Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.

La Offering Artificial Intelligence & Data è pertanto l’opzione best in class nell’individuazione, progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Big Data Management, con un approccio agnostico dal punto di vista tecnologico.

Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali
Brillante percorso accademico con laurea specialistica in materie STEM

column1: Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

column7:
disponibilità a lavorare in trasferta, anche all’estero

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit &
column8:
Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

3954874557,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-quality-analyst-at-sennder-3954874557?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=ZtcauJwoAnpwzFC3nxrGCw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Quality Analyst,sennder,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Quality Analyst (fixed-term contract)

sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Quality Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionise road freight logistics. You would join our “Operations Program & Innovation” department, based out of the Milan office and will report to the Team Lead Ops. Quality.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll work on interesting responsibilities like supporting the Operations Programs & Innovation department and specifically the Network Quality Team by analyzing and identifying logistic network inefficiencies, managing carriers delays and penalties.
Ensure compliance with service quality KPIs by monitoring and supporting continuous performance improvement.
Work together with carriers to reduce the impact of low performances through bonus/malus mechanisms.
Analyze operational issues by identifying their root causes and proposing corrective actions through daily KPIs monitoring (e.g., on-time performance, incidents).
Build supplier performance reports in order to create presentations useful to management.
Support the definition of processes with the aim of identifying best practices and improving performance.
Work closely with Operations and Program Management teams to improve our quality metrics.
Develop and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree in economics, statistics, engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Proficiency in G-Suite and MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint)
column2: essential proficiency in SQL.

column1: Strong analytical skills to conduct analyses and translate them into actionable insights.
Proactive, self-starter with excellent organizational skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and adaptive mindset with the ability to learn quickly.
Strong team player with a collaborative attitude.

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.
Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000 people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click [here] for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.
If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

3966871359,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-bi-specialist-at-venchi-3966871359?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=t6uzms2di1Xp4uXMsgwWYw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Engineer & BI Specialist,Venchi,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"We are looking for a Data Engineer & BI Specialist that will work alongside a Business Data Manager and a Data Engineer to support the company in growing data management and analytics performance.

In this position, you will play a pivotal role in supporting different teams in analytics needs, driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will be the champion for our data strategy and will be dedicated to develop data pipelines, new data integration, creation of new measures and building powerful dashboards to support the business in their decisions.
Monitoring existing data pipelines across efficiency KPIs to proactively identify areas requiring maintenance
Collect issues and feedbacks reported by end-users and collaborate with team to solve it
Assetize data pipelines developed as to maximize re-usability
Identify innovative data ingestion and preparation techniques to optimize run-time and robustness of data pipeline
Ensure data Governance rules are enforced and proactively identify risk hindering compliant use of data
Calculate new metrics and develop ad hoc analysis to support the business needs
Design and develop dashboards using PowerBI to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions
Maintain documentation related to data management processes and ETL pipelines
1-2 years of experience in a similar role
Master’s Degree Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics or similar
Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
Experience with any cloud provider - Azure/AWS/GCP
Experience in designing and implementing end-to-end data pipelines is a plus
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with non-technical stakeholders
Results-oriented with the ability to work independently and in a team
... and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!

column2:
BI Specialist that will work alongside a Business Data Manager and a Data Engineer to support the company in growing data management and analytics performance.


In this position, you will play a pivotal role in supporting different teams in analytics needs, driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will be the champion for our data strategy and will be dedicated to develop data pipelines, new data integration, creation of new measures and building powerful dashboards to support the business in their decisions.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitoring existing data pipelines across efficiency KPIs to proactively identify areas requiring maintenance
  • Collect issues and feedbacks reported by end-users and collaborate with team to solve it
  • Assetize data pipelines developed as to maximize re-usability
  • Identify innovative data ingestion and preparation techniques to optimize run-time and robustness of data pipeline
  • Ensure data Governance rules are enforced and proactively identify risk hindering compliant use of data
  • Calculate new metrics and develop ad hoc analysis to support the business needs
  • Design and develop dashboards using PowerBI to meet business needs
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions
  • Maintain documentation related to data management processes and ETL pipelines


The Ideal Candidate:

  • 1-2 years of experience in a similar role
  • Master’s Degree Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics or similar
  • Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
  • In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
  • Experience with any cloud provider - Azure/AWS/GCP
  • Experience using DevOps, GitHub
  • Passion for new technologies
  • Experience in designing and implementing end-to-end data pipelines is a plus
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with non-technical stakeholders
  • Results-oriented with the ability to work independently and in a team
  • Interest in the consumer goods
  • Fluent English
  • ... and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!

3997719190,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-match-digital-3997719190?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=Eb%2B57MQlHdn4sRtdMpG97w%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Analyst,Match Digital,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.

With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.
Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.
We’re hiring for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-centric analytical products to develop business intelligence solutions in a transactional retail-tech business.
The Data Analyst will help implement best-in-class corporate reporting tools, reporting into the Corporate Reporting Manager within the Data & Analytics team.
Support with the production of bespoke corporate reports in Tableau and MicroStrategy.
Analyse data for internal stakeholders and analyse & support internal user requests for data and analytics to be deployed into the BI platform.
Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of the business strategy.
Worked as a Data Analyst or BI Analyst with experience developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients.
The ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data.
Advanced knowledge of data visualisation tools - Tableau OR MicroStrategy are a bonus.

Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)

Competitive salary + 10% bonus + benefits

Milan


Our client


Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.


With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.


Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.


The role


We’re hiring for a Data Analyst with a passion for data-centric analytical products to develop business intelligence solutions in a transactional retail-tech business.


The Data Analyst will help implement best-in-class corporate reporting tools, reporting into the Corporate Reporting Manager within the Data &
column2:
Analytics team.


Some of the responsibilities include


  • Support with the production of bespoke corporate reports in Tableau and MicroStrategy.
  • Analyse data for internal stakeholders and analyse &
column3:
support internal user requests for data and analytics to be deployed into the BI platform.
  • Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of the business strategy.


    • To apply, you should have


    • Worked as a Data Analyst or BI Analyst with experience developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients.
    • The ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data.
    • Advanced knowledge of data visualisation tools - Tableau OR MicroStrategy are a bonus.
    • SQL knowledge (intermediate).
    • Advanced Excel.
    • Fluent English.

3981803841,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-business-analyst-at-wehunt-3981803841?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=zndXEUU5gp4w5f2MEsj40g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data/Business Analyst,WeHunt,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Per realtà tech leader nel settore e-commerce di food and beverage, operante da oltre 10 anni ma con un'anima fortemente startupper, siamo alla ricerca di un Data/Business Analyst. La risorsa lavorerà in sinergia con le diverse Business Unit aziendali, creando report continuativi per sostenere e guidare lo sviluppo dell'azienda.

Interagire con i team operativi aziendali (business, marketing, prodotto, pricing ed operations) e assistere nella guida dell'azienda verso soluzione e supportare la raccolta dei requisiti aziendali e/o funzionali.
Creare e implementare dashboard e report in linea con le linee guida per una comunicazione efficace delle informazioni per gli utenti chiave e finali
Utilizzare tool di Business Intelligence & SQL per analisi dati, reportistica e supporto ai KPI aziendali.
Verifica e validazione dei modelli di analisi richiesti
Identificazione dei dati necessari e definizione della logica delle query.
Dettagliare le esigenze di business dal punto di vista funzionale
Redigere documenti di analisi funzionale per le differenti Business Unit dell'azienda.
Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Esperienza tra i 3 e i 7 anni come Business Analyst/ Data Analyst
Conoscenza di SQL per query e analisi
Conoscenza di tool di BI come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau
Spiccate doti comunicative e capacità di collaborare con diversi team
Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa nel campo dell’analisi dati/ analisi funzionale in aziende Tech, Digital e/o eCommerce
Lavoro flessibile con possibilità di smart working su base settimanale
Range Retributivo: RAL compresa tra i 30.000.00 - 45.000.00 euro

Per realtà tech leader nel settore e-commerce di food and beverage, operante da oltre 10 anni ma con un'anima fortemente startupper, siamo alla ricerca di un Data/Business Analyst. La risorsa lavorerà in sinergia con le diverse Business Unit aziendali, creando report continuativi per sostenere e guidare lo sviluppo dell'azienda.

  • Creare e implementare dashboard e report in linea con le linee guida per una comunicazione efficace delle informazioni per gli utenti chiave e finali

3922742885,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-data-governance-at-ntt-data-italia-3922742885?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=uHDlaLjERQYTvH0BkntA1Q%3D%3D&trackingId=WAFEwAZnzjM2%2F%2F9watr0GQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Analista Data Governance,NTT DATA Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.
Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!
Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.
Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso
Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi
Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell’ambito di Data Governance.
Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.
Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
Capacità di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)
Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.

Rientrano Nei Suoi Compiti

  • Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso

• Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
  • Informatica Axon
  • Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC)
  • Informatica MDM

3985516021,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-%E2%80%93-artificial-intelligence-and-data-%E2%80%93-roma-milano-napoli-consulting-at-deloitte-3985516021?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=6tU24Q8u7o1WTBWn7BxgpA%3D%3D&trackingId=qTGZyBP8r%2BFWOIbpsoUIFw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Junior – Artificial Intelligence and Data – Roma, Milano, Napoli - Consulting",Deloitte,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Stiamo cercando una figura junior da inserire nel team di Artificial Intelligence and Data di Deloitte Consulting nelle sedi di Roma/Milano/Napoli, che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Nel Team di Artificial Intelligence & Data avrai l’occasione di aiutare, in ambito Analytics, le aziende a valorizzare i dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee trasformandoli in informazioni accurate e immediatamente utilizzabili, elementi indispensabili per quelle aziende che vogliono fare decision-making fact-driven. La Offering Artificial Intelligence & Data è pertanto l’opzione best in class nell’individuazione, progettazione e implementazione di soluzioni di Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Big Data Management, con un approccio agnostico dal punto di vista tecnologico.
La risorsa Junior sarà inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:
Interpretare proattivamente i bisogni del cliente, individuando metodologie e approcci coerenti
Sviluppare iniziative e soluzioni in modo indipendente, raccogliendo ed analizzando dati a supporto dell’elaborazione di soluzioni per i clienti
Elaborare teaser e presentazioni per supportare il top management
Individuare potenziali rischi e criticità e condividerli tempestivamente con il resto del team
Collaborare efficacemente in team eterogenei ed internazionali
Brillante percorso accademico con laurea specialistica in materie STEM
Familiarità con la modellazione e linguaggio di interrogazione dei data base
column2: conoscenza di uno o più linguaggi di accesso al dato e programmazione (Python, R, Java, SQL)
column3: ottima conoscenza degli applicativi MS Word, MS Excel e MS Power Point
column4: nozioni accademiche di modelli statistici per l’analisi dei dati

column1: Forte propensione/interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica

Elevata attitudine a lavorare sia autonomamente che in team, capacità analitiche e di problem solving, gestione dello stress, flessibilità, precisione e uno spiccato orientamento al raggiungimento dei risultati

column2: disponibilità a lavorare in trasferta, anche all’estero

column1: Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.
Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

3957593811,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-product-team-at-satispay-3957593811?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=6tU24Q8u7o1WTBWn7BxgpA%3D%3D&trackingId=PImJZddWUx8VHjAoSCfrSg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Data Analyst, Product Team",Satispay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About Satispay
At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2: we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

column1: Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.
🚀 Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.

Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.

Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.
🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with
🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers
🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills
⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget
🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan
👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment
🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!
Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2:
we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech &
column3:
Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
  • Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
  • Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

3989390121,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-business-insight-analyst-at-giorgio-armani-3989390121?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=6tU24Q8u7o1WTBWn7BxgpA%3D%3D&trackingId=3mLuUBu7LL8TazlZ4B1H2g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Digital Business Insight Analyst,Giorgio Armani,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Descrizione lavoro:

The Armani Group is a leading company in the fashion and luxury sector, with more than 8,000 employees. Its three core brands – Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange – are active in many countries all over the world. With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Today, therefore, as well as being well known in the area of fashion, the Armani Group is also renowned in the sectors of interior design, food and beverage, and hotels and resorts. Giorgio Armani has created a style that has, with remarkable consistency, continued to explore countless variations and possibilities over the years. It expresses a precise vision down to the most minute detail: a way of being and presenting oneself, certainly incorporating clothing and accessories, but also including gestures, ways, behaviours and attitudes
column2: a style that goes beyond the sum of its parts, and well beyond what one wears. Convinced that ethics and aesthetics must coincide, Giorgio Armani expresses fundamental and enduring values his clothes. He does so by creating timeless pieces that, enhanced by precious materials and artisanal craftwork, resist the whim of fleeting trends with their pure and essential design.

column1: Context and Purpose of the job

Within the Digital Business Unit, you will join the Business Intelligence & CRO Management team. You will play a pivotal role in supporting the team in all the daily analysis regarding E-commerce, identifying and sharing actional insights to different stakeholders.Responsibilities
Process and analyze E-commerce data using data analysis tools to identify actionable insights to maximize online revenue and find new opportunities
Follow deep dive analysis on several business aspects and clearly communicating results to different stakeholders
Conduct standard monthly/weekly/daily reports focusing on brand/region/countries performance
Design, develop and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI, ensuring the accuracy of the data provided
Support the Digital Team in the extraction of data and creation of ad-hoc analysis
Analyze performance at product level and quantify the impact of promotions both in terms of revenues and business impact
Collaborate with Retail, CRM, Merchandising and Buying team in order to provide comprehensive analysis of different collections/seasons
Provide analysis and interpretation of internal/external market data, highlighting any underlying trends to identify new market opportunities to increase the organization’s profitability
Keep the Digital Team updated on the latest trends focusing on E-commerce and Competition in the Fashion Industry
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science
Previous experience of 2 years in business analytics, the experience in E-Commerce will be considered a plus
Advanced Excel required, knowledge of Power BI (or other similar Data VisualizationTools) and other BI tools (SAP BO, Microstrategy, ecc).
Analytical skills, organization, proactivity, attention to details, strong communication skills.
We promote diversity and inclusion in all forms, within a collaborative environment where your talent can flourish in the pursuit of a common goal: yours and our growth.

Descrizione lavoro:

The Armani Group is a leading company in the fashion and luxury sector, with more than 8,000 employees. Its three core brands – Giorgio Armani, Emporio Armani and A|X Armani Exchange – are active in many countries all over the world. With origins firmly rooted in Italy, but also with a cosmopolitan vision and culture, the company has grown since it was founded in 1975, expanding its offer from clothes and accessories to cosmetics, fragrances, eyewear, watches, jewellery, and furniture and furnishing accessories. Today, therefore, as well as being well known in the area of fashion, the Armani Group is also renowned in the sectors of interior design, food and beverage, and hotels and resorts. Giorgio Armani has created a style that has, with remarkable consistency, continued to explore countless variations and possibilities over the years. It expresses a precise vision down to the most minute detail: a way of being and presenting oneself, certainly incorporating clothing and accessories, but also including gestures, ways, behaviours and attitudes
column2: a style that goes beyond the sum of its parts, and well beyond what one wears. Convinced that ethics and aesthetics must coincide, Giorgio Armani expresses fundamental and enduring values his clothes. He does so by creating timeless pieces that, enhanced by precious materials and artisanal craftwork, resist the whim of fleeting trends with their pure and essential design.

3982947603,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-specialist-at-rgi-group-3982947603?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=6tU24Q8u7o1WTBWn7BxgpA%3D%3D&trackingId=CwxDEFf7k3PCGxdG6OHSJw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST,RGI Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The candidate will work in the R&D Product Factory, as part of the Business Intelligence & AI team with other experts in the field and will report to the BI & Data Science Lead.
The main activities required to the selected candidate aims at consolidating and widening the general knowledge and technological knowhow of RGI in the field of the Business Intelligence.
Implement reports and dashboards leveraging best in class business intelligence tool (e.g. Qlik Sense)
Conduct analysis on insurance business topics: interview with client, formalization of business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards
Design & build management information dashboards to monitor internal processes and answer business questions about trends, opportunities, and data quality issues
Became responsible of specific project stream, ensuring a high level of data quality for core data sources and relevant KPIs
Research tools, frameworks and mechanisms for data analytics providing input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the company BI systems

Collaborate with Data Scientists in the RGI R&D Innovation Department, contributing in the development of new algorithms and models, providing application with vertical focus on the Insurance Industry
Experiences: 1-3 years’ experience in a Business intelligence and Analytics position.
Previous experience with the business intelligence tool Qlik Sense/Qlik View
Proficiency in database query construction and data mining (SQL, PL/SQL)
Experience in ETL tools (e.g. Talend, IBM DataStage, Business Objects, Alteryx, etc.) and management of databases is a strong plus
Knowledge with one of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB, SAS is a plus
Knowledge of big data architecture and data manipulation tools, based on Cloudera and HortonWorks (e.g. Apache Spark, Elasticsearch, Kafka….) is a plus
Proven capability to quickly grasp new processes and technologies
Willingness of learning and delivering innovation-based products to a wider audience
Attention to detail, passion for processes, systems and data mining
Education: The candidate will have a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline.

This announcement is addressed to candidates of both sexes pursuant to the law (L.903 / 77 and Legislative Decree No. 98/2006, art. 27). The interested party is invited to send his / her application by giving specific consent to the processing of personal data, pursuant to the new European Privacy Law, in accordance with articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR (Regulation (EU), 27 April 2016, n. 2016/679).
