3987193930,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-developer-analyst-sales-marketing-at-scalapay-3987193930?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=GSx8aepkCMuLGfa9Lqejmg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2B6NoSFNsFXg31SxInSLV8g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst - Sales & Marketing,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Strategy teams, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our Marketing and Sales team, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling
You’ll be great for this role if:
You have a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, preferably within a Sales and Marketing environment, and ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools
You have experience working with CRM tools
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary band we have for this position is 40'000€-50'000€ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
The first interview with the Hiring Manager to dive deep into your experiences and better understand your motivation
A case study to test your hard skills
A final chat with Simone, our CEO
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Strategy teams, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our Marketing and Sales team, providing them with necessary support
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling

You’ll be great for this role if:

  • You have a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field
  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, preferably within a Sales and Marketing environment, and ideally with a background in startups or fintech
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools
  • You have experience working with CRM tools
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
  • You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary band we have for this position is 40'000€-50'000€ (Gross Annual Base)
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
  • The first interview with the Hiring Manager to dive deep into your experiences and better understand your motivation
  • A case study to test your hard skills
  • A final chat with Simone, our CEO

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

3996526624,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-specialist-at-abb-3996526624?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=GSx8aepkCMuLGfa9Lqejmg%3D%3D&trackingId=7dC8NGOUSidtjfTzNtuL%2BA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Specialist,ABB,"Sesto San Giovanni, Lombardy, Italy","At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.
The work model for the role is:
This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).
You will be mainly accountable for:
Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup
You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages
Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division’s products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap® cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems® protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold™ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac™ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant™ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.
We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
For further info: Davide Lippiello, Talent Partner

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Pricing Specialist

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.

The work model for the role is:

This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).

You will be mainly accountable for:

  • Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
  • Designing database systems
  • Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
  • Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
  • Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
  • Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
  • Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup

You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.


Qualifications For The Role

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
  • You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
  • You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
  • You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
  • You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages

What's in it for you?

  • Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
  • Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
  • Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!

More about us

Adecco Consultant ricerca per Hoya Lens Italia, azienda Multinazionale Giapponese settore oftalmico, con sede a Garbagnate M.se, un/una :


Data Operations Analyst


La risorsa verrà inserita all’interno del Global Rx Control &
column2:
Support Team e avrà la responsabilità della preparazione e mantenimento di tutta la reportistica di produzione a livello internazionale, in affiancamento ad altre risorse già presenti. Dovrà garantire l'integrità, la qualità e la disponibilità dei dati, supportando le decisioni strategiche attraverso l'analisi, con particolare attenzione al miglioramento dei KPI e dei processi produttivi.


Titolo di studi:

Laurea in facoltà tecnico scientifiche STEM, con particolare focus a laureati nell’ambito tecnico/Ingegneristico.


Responsabilità principali:

  • Preparare e mantenere report di produzione a livello internazionale.
  • Assicurare l'integrità, la qualità e la disponibilità dei dati.
  • Supportare le decisioni strategiche attraverso analisi dei dati.
  • Concentrarsi sul miglioramento dei KPI e dei processi produttivi.
  • Collaborare con il team globale per ottimizzare i processi e migliorare le performance.


Competenze necessarie:

Esperienza, seppur breve, in ruoli similari in contesti produttivi strutturati.

Lingua inglese fluente (scritta e parlata).

  • Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office, con particolare attenzione a Excel.
  • Eccellente capacità di analisi.
  • Attenzione ai dettagli e forte orientamento alla qualità dei dati.
  • Comunicare efficacemente con diverse figure/ruoli a livello internazionale.
  • Abilità nel gestire più compiti contemporaneamente rispettando le scadenze richieste.


Si offre

  • Contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato con RAL commisurata all’esperienza maturata
  • E’ previsto un primo periodo di formazione in produzione, al fine di capire e conoscere tutti i processi produttivi e le dinamiche operative


Sede di lavoro: Garbagnate Milanese (MI)

Orario: Full time

3987193927,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-lead-at-scalapay-3987193927?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=GSx8aepkCMuLGfa9Lqejmg%3D%3D&trackingId=LYoNVlmtPB2xRzjXj%2BddpA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Intelligence Lead,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Are you a seasoned Business Intelligence professional with a passion for fintech innovation? We are looking for an experienced and motivated Business Intelligence Lead to drive data-driven decision-making and enhance our business performance.
At Scalapay, you'll lead a dynamic team, develop cutting-edge BI strategies, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to uncover actionable insights.

The ideal candidate will have an exceptional ability to analyze data, a strategic vision, and the expertise to derive actionable insights from complex data sets. As the Business Intelligence Lead, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and business performance improvements across Scalapay.
If you have a proven track record in BI, strong analytical skills, and excellent communication abilities, we'd love to hear from you!
Lead, mentor, and develop a team of BI analysts
Define and implement the overall BI strategy aligned with Scalapay’s business goals
Foster a culture of data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement across the organization
Act as a support partner to various business departments, helping them leverage data to achieve their goals and optimize their operations.
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for collecting, processing, and analyzing data
Create, manage, and deliver insightful and actionable BI reports and dashboards
Conduct deep-dive analysis to uncover insights, trends, and opportunities for business growth.
Work closely with cross-functional teams including Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Finance to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights
Serve as a key advisor to senior leadership on data-driven strategies and performance metrics
Communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and reliability of data across all business systems and processes
Implement and oversee data governance policies and best practices
Drive data quality initiatives to continually improve data reliability and usability.
Evaluate and implement BI tools and technologies to enhance data analysis and reporting capabilities
Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure Scalapay’s BI infrastructure remains cutting-edge.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field
Proven experience (5+ years) in a BI, data analytics, or similar role, preferably within fintech or a high-growth technology company
Strong expertise in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used in data analysis
Demonstrated ability to lead and develop high-performing analytical teams
Excellent problem-solving skills and strategic thinking abilities
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders
Proven track record of driving business growth through data-driven insights.
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment with a talented team:
Collaborative culture that fosters professional growth and development:
Flexible working hours and remote working opportunities:
A quick chat with one of our Talent Acquisition team members
A first interview with the Hiring Manager to deep dive into your experiences and better understand your motivation
A case study to test your hard skills, that will be debriefed with the Hiring Manager and a panel of colleagues
A final chat with Simone (our CEO) to understand your motivation and alignment to company values.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

The ideal candidate will have an exceptional ability to analyze data, a strategic vision, and the expertise to derive actionable insights from complex data sets. If you have a proven track record in BI, strong analytical skills, and excellent communication abilities, we'd love to hear from you!

3922742885,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-data-governance-at-ntt-data-italia-3922742885?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=GSx8aepkCMuLGfa9Lqejmg%3D%3D&trackingId=hNeU3NeD1cJ3hIgwC98IQw%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Analista Data Governance,NTT DATA Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.
Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!
Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.
Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso
Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi
Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell’ambito di Data Governance.
Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.
Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
Capacità di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)
Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.

Con più di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.

Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.

Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.

Rientrano Nei Suoi Compiti

  • Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso
column2: • Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi
column3:
• Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
  • Informatica Axon
  • Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC)
  • Informatica MDM


    • Required Skills

    • Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
    • Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell’ambito di Data Governance.
    • Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.


    Completano Il Profilo

    • Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
    • Capacità di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
    • Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)


    Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

3826200158,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-consultant-internship-milano-cns-at-pwc-italy-3826200158?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=GSx8aepkCMuLGfa9Lqejmg%3D%3D&trackingId=UhtUf8I7nrjqCYh9bWRzcA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data & Analytics Consultant - INTERNSHIP - Milano [CNS],PwC Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","""Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Technology Consulting di PwC e diventa:""

Prenderai parte a diversi progetti di trasformazione del business dei principali players in ambito Automotive & Industrial Manufacturing, Consumer Markets, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Telco & Media attraverso l’efficientamento e la reingegnerizzazione dei processi interni.
Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.
Sarai coinvolto in progetti di consulenza e maturerai esperienza su tematiche di Data Warehouse, Big Data, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
Aiuterai i nostri clienti ad esplorare nuove opportunità di business principalmente occupandoti di:
Costruzione di architetture Big Data, implementazione di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, analisi dei dati e rappresentazione degli stessi, attraverso l’utilizzo di tool dedicati
Valutazione delle strutture organizzative di presidio e gestione dei dati nelle organizzazioni
Attività e progetti in ambito Data Visualization

3978069553,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-assistant-at-guerlain-3978069553?position=7&pageNum=7&refId=i9mV%2Fj8UUF9sOkUtNIPkgg%3D%3D&trackingId=Aj7k%2Bj9QafWCTjqOqXR9tg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Analyst Assistant,Guerlain,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Since 1828, Guerlain has been dedicated to create absolute Beauty and transmit a more beautiful world. To reveal wonders – through the craft of exceptional products, but also through the development of exceptional and audacious talents.

We run a transformation at a fast pace and are onboarded on the accelerating elevation journey that will lead us to the clear destination of being the most iconic high perfumery and high cosmetic house in image and products, above the competition, the most exclusive one.
As part of the Guerlain Italy Team, the intern will actively support Guerlain’s Business Analyst in the management of the following activities:
Collecting, analyzing, evaluating and reporting data to increase general sales productivity and control
Tracking and analysis of sales figures: sell-in, sell-out (by axe/retailer), managing daily, weekly and monthly reports
NPD analysis about Market / Competition / Top Cities
Analysis on benchmark and sell-out potential for new products’ launches
Follow-up analysis on new launches performance vs target
Analysis on door productivity, profitability and on KPIs
Managing business intelligence topics, reports and analysis for all departments (marketing, sales, merchandising, retail, training)
Support sales team presentations during Canvass
Excellent analytical skills and data-driven mindset
Proactivity, problem solving, precision, attention to detail
Dynamic and flexible person with good time management skills and teamwork approach
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications (especially Excel, Power Point)
Knowledge of Power BI or other BI tools is considered a plus
Excellent level of English and Italian

3989108756,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-business-analyst-junior-it-at-eni-3989108756?position=9&pageNum=7&refId=i9mV%2Fj8UUF9sOkUtNIPkgg%3D%3D&trackingId=GgKOgasQEugP6HSift4QnQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,POWER BUSINESS ANALYST JUNIOR (IT),Eni,"San Donato Milanese, Lombardy, Italy","Job Description

In Eni siamo alla ricerca di una/un Power Business Analyst Junior che, all’interno del team di Power Portfolio Management per l’area Power Generation & Marketing della direzione Energy Evolution, si occupi dell’analisi tecnico – economica per il business power.

Entrerai a far parte del team Power Generation & Marketing della Direzione Energy Evolution, Le persone Eni che lavorano in quest'area si occupano di gestire e ottimizzare il portafoglio power, presidiando i risk commodities e sviluppando attività commerciali e di trading power. In chiave di riconversione del circuito produttivo, la struttura PWG&M ha l’obiettivo di individuare e sviluppare, attraverso tecnologie innovative, nuove opportunità di business al fine di creare valore aggiunto per l’azienda.
All’interno del team di Power Portfolio Management & Trading, ti occuperai di:
Studiare e analizzare il contesto economico di riferimento del business power
Sviluppare analisi tecnico–economiche a supporto delle decisioni di business, nell’ottica dell’ottimizzazione di medio–lungo termine del portfolio power
Analizzare e supportare la valutazione di specifici progetti e potenziali investimenti
Elaborare voci previsionali e consolidare la proposta di piano e budget della business unit
Sviluppare la reportistica per l’analisi dei risultati economici del business power, evidenziando gli scostamenti rispetto agli obiettivi di budget e individuando i contributi delle singole attività
Predisporre presentazioni riguardanti risultati economici per condivisione con il management
Gestire i contratti di conto lavorazione (tolling) con le società proprietarie degli impianti di produzione di energia elettrica
Questa è l’opportunità per te se rispondi a questi requisiti:
Laurea magistrale in Matematica, Fisica, Statistica, Ingegneria matematica o fisica, Economia, purché ad indirizzo quantitativo
È gradita la conoscenza di uno o più linguaggi di programmazione (python, r, matlab, sql)
Buona conoscenza del pacchetto Microsoft Office e del sistema operativo Microsoft
Predisposizione all’analisi di natura quantitativa ed economica.

column2: potrà essere preso in considerazione un contratto a Tempo Indeterminato in base all’esperienza maturata.

column1: In Eni crediamo nelle persone intraprendenti, capaci di fare la differenza e dare il proprio contributo con passione e innovazione, per rispondere alle sfide globali della transizione energetica. Consideriamo fondamentali competenze e attitudini di ciascuno , formazione continua , diversità e inclusione. Promuoviamo forme flessibili di lavoro con una particolare attenzione al benessere, al welfare e al work life-balance.

Eni valuterà le candidature pervenute considerando la pluralità e la diversità come fonti di arricchimento. Se sarai tra le persone valutate maggiormente in linea con il profilo richiesto, verrai contattata/o per continuare il processo di selezione.
Qualsiasi sia la tua ambizione, in Eni puoi trovare gli strumenti per realizzarla.

3994494159,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/database-developer-at-kirey-group-3994494159?position=7&pageNum=10&refId=nhdU0N8B8bJ0Ey8BAVIPRw%3D%3D&trackingId=GvQzfL5Oo3uP7pbjZ47Cew%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Database Developer,Kirey Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","✨Kirey Group è un system integrator presente in 10 Paesi con più 1000 dipendenti e 10 mila business case attivi. La nostra mission consiste nell'accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di evoluzione tecnologica verso organizzazioni agili, sicure e pronte ad affrontare positivamente il cambiamento.

Il nostro modello si fonda su tre principali pillar: System Integration, dove l’azienda mette al servizio dei clienti la propria IT Factory per unire le tecnologie già adottate con le migliori offerte del mercato
column2: Advising, con servizi pensati per permettere alle imprese di adottare nuovi modelli di business e progettare congiuntamente soluzioni tecnologiche di alto valore
column3: infine R&D, per un’innovazione che funge da alimentazione costante dell’azienda, alla ricerca di soluzioni che siano sempre all’avanguardia, in grado di recepire i trend tecnologici globali, come l’IoT, l’AI e Machine Learning, e di assicurare un vantaggio competitivo per i clienti.

column1: Il nostro portfolio spazia da Data Management a DevOps, passando per Automation & Infrastructure, Cloud, Monitoring e Cybersecurity. Alla base di tutto questo ci sono le persone, che in Kirey Group trovano spazio per esprimere al massimo il proprio talento e per sentirsi parte attiva nella catena del valore dell'azienda. Ciò è possibile grazie a: investimenti costanti nei processi di miglioramento, attraverso la formazione
column2: idee innovative e stimolo alla creatività, grazie al consolidamento delle competenze
column3: e, ancora, a una particolare sensibilità - che si esprime in progetti ad hoc - nei confronti dell'inclusione e della diversità.

column1: Per la nostra Area Fondi Pensione ricerchiamo un* Database Developer.
Comprendere i requisiti aziendali e le logiche per implementare procedure robuste, estensibili e ad alte prestazioni
Sviluppare, comunicare e supportare la conformità con i modelli standard
Creare nuovi pacchetti e procedure Oracle PL/SQL e revisionare quelli esistenti per supportare l’attività di sviluppo
Revisionare procedure, funzioni e pacchetti Oracle PL/SQL per migliorare e ottimizzare le prestazioni
Fornire supervisione ed esperienza agli sviluppatori di app nella scrittura e ottimizzazione di SQL, nella codifica e nel deployment di SQL, store procedure o funzioni del database
Esperienza comprovata nell'analisi e nello sviluppo di applicazioni utilizzando Oracle 19c+
Esperienza comprovata nell'assistenza al personale di sviluppo delle app con la progettazione di database e procedure memorizzate
Esperienza nell'uso di metodi di caricamento massivo – Oracle sqlldr, tabelle esterne
Conoscenza delle logiche aziendali dei Fondi Pensione

Le candidature ideali provengono da persone con più di 7 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di procedure, funzioni e pacchetti Oracle PL/SQL, laureate in una delle seguenti facoltà: Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Elettronica, Matematica e Fisica. IL TUO RUOLO

Per la nostra Area Fondi Pensione ricerchiamo un* Database Developer.

Le attività previste sono:

  • Comprendere i requisiti aziendali e le logiche per implementare procedure robuste, estensibili e ad alte prestazioni
  • Sviluppare, comunicare e supportare la conformità con i modelli standard
  • Creare nuovi pacchetti e procedure Oracle PL/SQL e revisionare quelli esistenti per supportare l’attività di sviluppo
  • Revisionare procedure, funzioni e pacchetti Oracle PL/SQL per migliorare e ottimizzare le prestazioni
  • Fornire supervisione ed esperienza agli sviluppatori di app nella scrittura e ottimizzazione di SQL, nella codifica e nel deployment di SQL, store procedure o funzioni del database


REQUISITI

  • Esperienza comprovata nell'analisi e nello sviluppo di applicazioni utilizzando Oracle 19c+
  • Esperienza comprovata nell'assistenza al personale di sviluppo delle app con la progettazione di database e procedure memorizzate


Rappresentano un plus:

  • Esperienza comprovata nell'amministrazione di database
  • Esperienza nell'uso di tabelle funzione
  • Esperienza nell'uso di metodi di caricamento massivo – Oracle sqlldr, tabelle esterne
  • Conoscenza delle logiche aziendali dei Fondi Pensione


CHI STIAMO CERCANDO

Le candidature ideali provengono da persone con più di 7 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo di procedure, funzioni e pacchetti Oracle PL/SQL, laureate in una delle seguenti facoltà: Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Elettronica, Matematica e Fisica. Hanno un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata), pensiero analitico e creativo. L'attitudine al lavoro in team, la capacità di problem solving e la proattività completano il profilo.

  • Ambiente dinamico e meritocratico

  • Piano di crescita professionale
  • Corsi di formazione e certificazioni
  • Sistema di Welfare&

3982419612,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-randstad-digital-belgium-3982419612?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=bxyWXD5BRQ1IVleya%2BSYGQ%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Randstad Digital Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst/data engineer
Our organisation is gaining maturity at the level of data management, data engineering and BI reporting. An experienced Data Analyst/Data engineer is needed in this context.
Main focus will be to support business in the creation & documentation of various reporting and dashboards (Payment transactions, Accounting, KYC, Logistics...).
The analyst will also have the opportunity to take part in some business and functional analyses activities.
As a Data Analyst/Data Engineer (s)he should be able to :
Communicate efficiently with business departments to gather, understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Get a clear view of all the data sources and data available
Identify which data are required to build the expected extraction and reporting
Collect and integrate data and perform data preparation and transformations in a secure manner, in order to produce reusable key data sets
Use these key data sets to produce reportings and analysis for our internal customers as well as regulatory reportings
Create clear documentation on the data collection and transformations
For this, you should be able to :
Build reports via Salesforce reporting module and/or build dashboards via Tableau or Power BI.
Export, merge and transform data with Power Query in case the data have not been integrated yet
column2: data security by design is key !

column1: Ensure data quality by implementing controls on the imported and produced data.
Discover trends and insights that could bring value to the business.
Organise and document functionally implemented data integrations and reports

Required experience and knowledge Solid practical experience as a data engineer of at least 5 years is needed in the activities listed on the Function Description for which resource needs to take the lead.
You have a solid IT background and know all about data modelling, data documentation, data collecting and transforming and GDPR/data protection, building good data structures.

You've worked in a BI context previously (Accounting, Billing, payment transaction, terminal management environment), capturing and delivering data in a structured manner, with reusable key data sets. You have developed dashboards and reportings. You know do's and don'ts to build such deliverables.
Good experience with IT activities (data models, API, data manipulation and transformation (doc included)

column2: Experience with market ETL/ELT tools is an advantage.

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
You dive into a large amount of data :
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

    • Experience with other data visualization tools like Tableau or QlikView is a plus.

3994868946,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-planet-pharma-3994868946?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MJnRgVHRBWxRbWRiGycO9A%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,Planet Pharma,Belgium,"Our client is a global European HQ'd biotech that has grown 90% in the past two years and has seen huge success with recent launches - their stocks/shares have absolutely rocketed as a result.

They are looking for a Subject Matter Expert (Data Analytics) to join their Business Information Systems team. Within this role you will be working in close collaboration with Quality and Regulatory teams, understanding, anticipating and influencing the demand for services and translating requirements into efficient and harmonised solutions. You would be working with Snowflake, Veeva and Matilion so need strong experience with these tools/systems.

3993754637,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/deals-data-analyst-at-pwc-belgium-3993754637?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=9WDO5Na7HkzU5EqPTwtFeg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Deals Data Analyst,PwC Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Line of Service
Leading with heart, living by values

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

Are you passionate about Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and the data that drives business decisions? Do you want to transform business data into meaningful insights? If so, PwC's Deal Analytics team is the place for you!

In the dynamic world of M&A, data is a vital source of value creation. However, many companies struggle to leverage it effectively. This is where PwC’s Deal Analytics team excels. We harness data to provide critical insights for buyers and sellers, enhancing their understanding of historical performance and uncovering new opportunities. As a data analyst, you will be at the heart of that, engaging in a wide array of tasks:
What you will learn and do
Harness the power of data and analytics to create (or break) a compelling story around a target business
Unlock value potential after a deal
Liaise with clients, advisors and/or other PwC teams to provide robust, data-driven insights (e.g. into business and value drivers)
Extract, transform and load (ETL) client and alternative data using a variety of tools
Automate manual processes to boost efficiency.
Utilize tools like Alteryx, R, or Python to conduct complex analyses
Create insightful visualizations using e.g. Power BI
Help our Deals Analytics team to further grow:
Coordinate our intern(s) and/or remote teams
Contribute to development of new services
column2: by building Proof-of-Concept solutions using new technology and techniques

column1: Be a digital accelerator for the broader Deals practice
Who You Are, What You’re Like
Earned a degree in a technology-related program, mathematics, statistics, civil or business engineering.
Worked as a data analyst/ data scientist/data engineer or BI-consultant/developer in a similar consulting environment with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
Possess an analytical mind with strong business acumen.
Skilled in communicating complex analyses effectively to diverse audiences.

column2: ideally also in Dutch and/or French.

column1: Knowledgeable in basic financial, accounting, and commercial principles.
Experience in working a range of data tools like:
Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or equivalent
ETL-tools such as Alteryx or equivalent
R, Python or other scripting tools (with advanced analytical capabilities)
Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.
Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.

Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).

Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.
Looking for a career where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!
Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)
Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Engineering
Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

3967538977,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-analyst-at-telenet-3967538977?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=yQiLo6Xw998eL5I7SqQdgA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data & Insights Analyst,Telenet,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","You’ll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).
Here are some key points about the role:
Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst
Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit’s facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit’s performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.
Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.

Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).
It’s a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you’re looking for in your next career move?
Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus
Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

3982028705,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-voo-3982028705?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=TZWXh%2F6UG2AcFUs3%2BuUNpg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Business Data Analyst,VOO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","In this role, you will be in charge of the creation and maintenance of KPI’s, reporting and dashboards, facilitating the steering of the Infrastructure activities, as well as of detailed data analysis and the presentation of the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions.
Identify and inventorize the data sources for the Infrastructure department, validate the data consistency and identity the necessary and potential improvements
Identify and define the KPI’s to be measured based on the requests and needs of the Teams within the Infrastructure department, the operational processes and own expertise within the domain.

Develop the steering KPI’s and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI’s and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance
Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‘ad hoc’ analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.
Synthesize and present the dashboards and the results of specific analyses together with the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions in a clear manner adapted to the audience.

Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders & experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.

Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.’s needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.’s essential KPI’s.
3 years of experience in a similar position
Data analysis and data management expertise
Mastery of IT tools linked to data extraction, data manipulation and data analysis
Interest in numbers (reports and KPIs), proactivity, excellent communication skills
Fluent French and a good level of English

A dynamic working environment where you have every opportunity for personal development. Moreover, you can look forward to the following compensation and benefits package: a market competitive salary, a company car, performance bonus, meal vouchers, 32 holidays per year, pension provision, life assurance and accident cover, and medical insurance.
Inspired? Then we would like to hear from you! If there’s a match in the making, we’ll invite you for a first interview.

In this role, you will be in charge of the creation and maintenance of KPI’s, reporting and dashboards, facilitating the steering of the Infrastructure activities, as well as of detailed data analysis and the presentation of the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions.


Your responsibilities:

  • Identify and inventorize the data sources for the Infrastructure department, validate the data consistency and identity the necessary and potential improvements
  • Identify and define the KPI’s to be measured based on the requests and needs of the Teams within the Infrastructure department, the operational processes and own expertise within the domain.
  • Develop the steering KPI’s and create / manage dashboards which integrate those KPI’s and enable an efficient monitoring and steering of the Infrastructure dep. activities, and be proactive / force of proposal on new reporting perspectives and data cross-referencing to provide the Infrastructure dep. with alternative view on performance
  • Analyze the trend evolutions through dashboards as well as performing ‘ad hoc’ analyses on specific topics, potentially by compiling / cross-referencing Infrastructure data with other data sources.
  • Synthesize and present the dashboards and the results of specific analyses together with the corresponding quantitative and qualitative conclusions in a clear manner adapted to the audience.
  • Reporting project management: planning creation and management, drive the different project phases through collaboration with internal / external stakeholders &
column2:
experts, communication of the progress / challenges / mitigations, and internal / external quality control after the move to production.
  • Contribute to transversal projects touching Infrastructure dep. as expert / interface of Infrastructure data management and reporting to ensure the consideration of Infrastructure dep.’s needs and the respect for Infrastructure dep.’s essential KPI’s.


    • Your profile:

    • University degree
    • 3 years of experience in a similar position
    • Dashboarding / reporting expertise
    • Data analysis and data management expertise
    • Mastery of IT tools linked to data extraction, data manipulation and data analysis
    • Interest in numbers (reports and KPIs), proactivity, excellent communication skills
    • Fluent French and a good level of English


    What we offer:

    A dynamic working environment where you have every opportunity for personal development. Moreover, you can look forward to the following compensation and benefits package: a market competitive salary, a company car, performance bonus, meal vouchers, 32 holidays per year, pension provision, life assurance and accident cover, and medical insurance.


    Inspired? Then we would like to hear from you! If there’s a match in the making, we’ll invite you for a first interview.

3992168947,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bmw-group-3992168947?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=fJayKDvI6HiwlDcYreKqQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MK9eeDgSb0TUxoN1FSo6Hg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Data Analyst,BMW Group,"Bornem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in het optimaliseren van data-gedreven besluitvorming binnen BMW Financial Services ? Als Data Analyst ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen. Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools, genereert waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunt de business bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
Met jouw sterke analytische vaardigheden, technische kennis en communicatieve talent, ben jij de ideale kandidaat om ons team te versterken. Solliciteer nu en maak het verschil!
Wat doe je als Data Analyst?
Je implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen, met als doel het gebruik van rapportages, informatie en data in het hele bedrijf te optimaliseren.
Je stemt de implementatie van nieuwe bedrijfsoplosssing af met interne stakeholders.
Je waarborgt de kwaliteit van de data d.m.v. data testings en een optimaal data quality beleid.
Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools als Tableau (of Power BI).
Je zorgt voor waardevolle zakelijke inzichten door data-analyse en -modellering.
Je ondersteunt de organisatie bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
Je treedt op als oplossingsarchitect op het gebied van interactieve rapportage en analyse.
Je maakt gebruik van bestaande systemen en functionaliteiten en stimuleert tegelijkertijd verdere innovatie.
Je ondersteunt de continue ontwikkeling van het rapportage- en analyselandschap en helpt bij de toepassing van AI en Machine Learning.
Waarmee kan je ons team versterken?
Je beschikt over sterke organisatorische, analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je kan je bevindingen en technische concepten op een vlotte, effectieve manier presenteren en overbrengen.
Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om nieuwe informatie en vaardigheden te leren, op te nemen en toe te passen.
Je hebt ervaring opgebouwd in data-analyse en data quality management.
Kennis van SQL en Tableau (of Power BI).
Kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira
Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en het Engels, zowel gesproken als geschreven.

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.

We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.

Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in het optimaliseren van data-gedreven besluitvorming binnen BMW Financial Services ? Als Data Analyst ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen. Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools, genereert waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunt de business bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.


Met jouw sterke analytische vaardigheden, technische kennis en communicatieve talent, ben jij de ideale kandidaat om ons team te versterken. Solliciteer nu en maak het verschil!


Wat doe je als Data Analyst?

  • Je implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen, met als doel het gebruik van rapportages, informatie en data in het hele bedrijf te optimaliseren.
  • Je stemt de implementatie van nieuwe bedrijfsoplosssing af met interne stakeholders.
  • Je waarborgt de kwaliteit van de data d.m.v. data testings en een optimaal data quality beleid.
  • Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools als Tableau (of Power BI).
  • Je zorgt voor waardevolle zakelijke inzichten door data-analyse en -modellering.
  • Je ondersteunt de organisatie bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
  • Je treedt op als oplossingsarchitect op het gebied van interactieve rapportage en analyse.
  • Je maakt gebruik van bestaande systemen en functionaliteiten en stimuleert tegelijkertijd verdere innovatie.
  • Je ondersteunt de continue ontwikkeling van het rapportage- en analyselandschap en helpt bij de toepassing van AI en Machine Learning.


Waarmee kan je ons team versterken?

  • Je beschikt over sterke organisatorische, analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je kan je bevindingen en technische concepten op een vlotte, effectieve manier presenteren en overbrengen.
  • Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om nieuwe informatie en vaardigheden te leren, op te nemen en toe te passen.
  • Je hebt ervaring opgebouwd in data-analyse en data quality management.
  • Kennis van Microsoft Office-toepassingen.
  • Kennis van SQL en Tableau (of Power BI).
  • Kennis van DW-concepten, -processen en -methodologie.
  • Kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira
  • Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en het Engels, zowel gesproken als geschreven.


What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.


We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.


Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with proficiency in SAS and Azure to join our dynamic team. Master’s degree in a related field.

Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.

This is a remote position.

Freelance job for a French / Duch speaking Data Analyst in Belgium. 12 month contract

Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with proficiency in SAS and Azure to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to leverage data to inform business decisions. This role involves working with cross-functional teams to collect, process, and analyze data, ensuring accuracy and integrity, and developing insights that drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets using SAS.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards in Azure.
  • Collaborate with business units to identify data needs and provide actionable insights.
  • Ensure data integrity and consistency across various data sources.
  • Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to support business objectives.
  • Create and maintain documentation for data processes, analysis methodologies, and reporting.
  • Support ad-hoc data requests and projects as needed.
  • Continuously improve data collection and analysis processes.

Qualifications:

  • Strong proficiency in SAS for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting.
  • Experience with Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Databricks, etc.).

  • Proficiency in SQL for querying databases.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in a related field.
  • Experience with additional programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
  • Certification in SAS and/or Azure.

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request
An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset
WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?
A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

Develop and execute test plans, scripts, and cases to ensure the quality and accuracy of Business Intelligence solutions.

Excellent analytical skills and a keen eye for detail.

Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, international environment.
Knowledge of the iGaming industry is a strong plus

My client a leading international iGaming operator, is seeking a meticulous and experienced QA Analyst to join our Business Intelligence department. In this role, you will be responsible for testing and validating the quality of our data solutions, ensuring that our BI initiatives meet the highest standards of accuracy and reliability.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute test plans, scripts, and cases to ensure the quality and accuracy of Business Intelligence solutions.
  • Identify, document, and track defects, working closely with the development team to resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Conduct regression testing and ensure that any updates or changes in BI systems do not negatively impact existing functionalities.
  • Analyze data to verify its accuracy, consistency, and completeness, and provide detailed feedback for improvements.
  • Continuously improve testing processes and methodologies to enhance the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the QA function.
  • Stay current with industry best practices, tools, and technologies related to BI and QA.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Proven experience as a QA Analyst, preferably in a BI or data-driven environment.
  • Strong understanding of data quality principles, BI processes, and tools.
  • Experience with SQL and other data query languages.
  • Excellent analytical skills and a keen eye for detail.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities, with a focus on identifying root causes and implementing effective solutions.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, international environment.
  • Knowledge of the iGaming industry is a strong plus
